chunks.text:
Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

ACCTPANI

Function-Account pan inquiry

1-Invoke the menu ACCTPANI

2-Select function code from dropdown

3-Enter valid PAN number

4-Click on submit button

5- Click on HPR menu to view the pan linked to account details.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

SOP-ADCREQ 
[ATM/DEBIT CARD GENERATION]

FUNCTION CODE-(R-READYKIT)

1. Invoke the menu ADCREQ. Select (through dropdown) ‘ R-READYKIT ’ for the mandatory field ‘function’.

2. Enter account number in the mandatory field a/c no.(card name<maximum 19 characters>)

3.select card type (‘N’-rupay debit card) from searcher.

4.Enter Reference number which is already available in stock.

5.Enter first name and last name of customer then click on validate button.

6.click on submit button.

FUNCTION CODE-(V-VERIFY)

. 
1.select (through dropdown) V-verify for the mandatory field ‘function’

2.Select (from searcher) or enter account number,which you want to verify,in the mandatory field A/C no. then click on

validate button.

3.Click on submit button.

FUNCTION CODE-(D-DELETE)

. 
1.Select (through dropdown) D-DELETE for the mandatory field ‘function’

2.Enter account number which you want to delete and click on searcher and select account number.

3.Click on submit button.

FUNCTION CODE-(DV-DELETE VERIFY)

. 
1.Select (through dropdown) DV-DELETE VERIFY for the mandatory field ‘function’

2.Select account number from searcher and click on account number.

3.Click on submit button.

FUNCTION CODE I-INQUIRE

. 
1.Select (through dropdown) I-INQUIRE for the mandatory field ‘function’

2.Enter account number which you want to inquire and click on searcher and select account number, system will display

details.

END OF DOCUMENT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India ) 
SOP-ATMREV

[ATM charge back claim form]
D-DATA GENERATION

1.Invoke the menu ‘ATMREV’. Select function code from drop down D-Data Generation.

2.click on go button.

3.Enter tran ID,tran date,reversal amount and remarks.

4.click on submit button.

X-CANCEL 
1. Invoke the menu ‘ATMREV’. Select function code from drop down X-CANCEL.

2.select reference number from searcher.

3.click on go button.

4.click on submit button.

V-VERIFY

1.select function code v-verify from dropdown.

2.select reference number from searcher.

3.click on go button.

4.click on submit button.

END OF DOCUMENT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

BLIFE 
 [BAJAJ LIFE TRANSACTION VERIFICATION] 
[NOTE: MENU USED TO VERIFY BAJAJ LIFE TRANSACTION ID GENERATED USING MENU ‘EPAY’] 
1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘BLIFE’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS ‘V-VERIFY’ AND SELECT VALID ‘EPAY ID’ FROM 
SEARCHER.

2. CLICK ON GO BUTTON THEN SYSTEM WILL NAVIGATE TO NEXT PAGE.
3. VALIDATE ALL DETAILS THEN CLICK ON SUBMIT BUTTON.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

MENU- CAACLA - CLOSE LOAN A/C (TERM LOAN) 
IF COLLATERAL EXIST THEN UNLINK THAT COLLATERAL BY MENU HSCLM 
1- INVOKE THE MENU CAACLA 
 SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS ‘Z- CLOSE’ 
 ENTER A/C ID (TERM LOAN A/C )

 CLICK ON GO

2- CLICK ON SUBMIT

VERIFY THE RECORD 
1. SELECT FUNCTION V-VERIFY. CLICK ON A/C ID SEARCHER AND SELECT REF NO.

2. CLICK ON GO

3. CLICK ON SUBMIT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

CASH TRANSACTION [CASHTR] 
FOR FUNCTION CODE “A-ADD” 
1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘CASHTR’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS “A-ADD” drop down.

2. THEN CLICK on GO button.

3. ENTER “TARGET SOL ID” AND “AMOUNT”.

4. CLICK SUBMIT THEN CLICK ‘OK’ ON POPUP MESSAGE .

FOR FUNCTION CODE “V-VERIFY” 
1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘CASHTR’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS ‘V-VERIFY’ from drop down AND select 
REQUEST ID USING SEARCHER.CLICK on GO button. CHECK ALL DETAILS ARE CORRECT AND CLICK 
SUBMIT.(update screenshot of front page)

2. CLICK ON OK BUTTON OF POPUP MESSAGE.

[NOTE: AFTER SUCCESSFUL VERIFICATION SYSTEM WILL CREDIT “CASH001” ACCOUNT AND DEBIT 
“CASHTR001” ACCOUNT OF THE SOL]

FOR FUNCTION CODE “K-ACKNOWLEDGE”

1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘CASHTR’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS ‘K-ACKNOWLEDGE’ AND REQUEST ID USING 
SEARCHER.

2. CLICK ON GO BUTTON.

3. CHECK ALL THE DETAILS ARE CORRECT THEN CLICK ON SUBMIT BUTTON.

4. CLICK OK BUTTON OF POPUP MESSAGE.

FOR FUNCTION CODE “Z-ACKNOWLEDGEMENT VERIFY” 
1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘CASHTR’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS ‘Z-ACKNOWLEDGEMENT VERIFY’ AND REQUEST 
ID USING SEARCHER.

2. CLICK ON GO BUTTON.

3. CHECK ALL THE DETAILS ARE CORRECT THEN CLICK SUBMIT.

[NOTE: AFTER SUCCESSFUL “ACKNOWLEDGEMENT VERIFICATION” SYSTEM WILL CREDIT “CASHTR001” 
ACCOUNT AND DEBIT “CASH001” ACCOUNT OF THE SOL]

END OF THE DOCUMENT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

CIBILERR 
(CIBIL ERROR REPORT DOWNLOAD) 
1. INVOKE THE MENU ‘CIBILERR’. ENTER ‘SET ID’ AND ‘REPORT DATE’.

2. CLICK SUBMIT.

3. INVOKE MENU ‘HPR’.

4. CLICK GO.
5. SELECT REPORT AND CLICK PRINT SCREEN TO VIEW.

chunks.text:
Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

CLOSURE FOR A/C CC OD NATURE UNDER COMPROMISE : MENU HCAAC

1. IF ACCOUNT TO BE CLOSED UNDER COMPROMISE(WHERE NO INTEREST HAS TO BE APPLIED) 
SELECT “NO” IN APPLY INTEREST TILL DATE UNDER TAB CLOSURE

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

COLLATERAL UNLINKING IN FIN10 LATDR ACCOUNT

UNLINK COLLATERAL FOR NEW LATDR [ACCOUNT OPEN IN FINACLE 10]. 
1. INVOKE THE MENU HLACM. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS M-MODIFY. ENTER LATDR 
ACCOUNT NO. IN A/C ID FIELD. CLICK GO.

2. TICK ON “RECORD DEL.” FLAG.

3. CLICK SUBMIT.

NOW USER TO VERIFY RECORD. AFTER VERIFICATION SYSTEM WILL UNLINK/DELETE THE 
COLLATERAL LINKED WITH A/C.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

NEW CORPORATE CIF MAKING PROCESS 
 SELECT CRM SERVER 
1- CLICK ON CIF CORPORATE-> NEW ENTITY-> CUSTOMER
2- ENTER THE FIELDS WITH VALID DATA ‘GENERAL-> BASIC INFO’

3- CLICK ON ‘IDENTIFICATION DOCUMENT’ TAB THEN CLICK ON ADD 
IDENTIFICATION DOCUMENT DETAILS 
IF PAN NO. NOT AVAILABLE THEN ENTER ‘FORM60’

4- SELECT VALID DOCUMENT TYPE AND CLICK ON SAVE

5- CLICK ON CONTACT TAB-> ADDRESS-> ADD ADDRESS DETAILS

6- FOR ‘CITY / STATE/ COUNTRY /DISTRICT’ ENTER FIRST THREE LETTERS 
WITH * MARK AND CLICK ON SEARCHER 
NEW PAGE WILL OPEN ‘AT LOCATION VALUE FIELD ENTER CITY/DISTRICT 
WITH % SIGN’AND SUBMIT IT. 
SELECT VALID DATA AND SAVE IT

7- CLICK ON ‘PHONE AND E-MAIL-> ADD PHONE AND E-MAIL’

8- SELECT PHONE-> TYPE AS MOBILE PHONE 1 THEN SAVE IT 
*PHONE NO. AS ‘FIRST BOX-> 91, THIRD BOX 10 DIGIT MOBILE NO.’

9- AGAIN CLICK ON ADD PHONE AND E-MAIL AND SELECT E-MAIL-> TYPE AS 
COMMUNICATION THEN SAVE IT

10- CLICK ON ‘CORE INTERFACE DETAILS’ 
ENTER ‘FREE TEXT 5-> REGULAR’ 
 FREE TEXT 7-> WALKIN’ 
 FREE TEXT15 (GENDER)-> M-MALE/ F-FEMALE/ O-OTHER’

11- NOW CLICK ON ‘CURRENCY‘ TAB -> ADD CCY-> SAVE

12- NOW CLICK ON ‘TAX CERTIFICATON DETAILS’ 
ENTER ‘FOREIGN A/C TAX REPORTING REQUIRED’ AS ‘N’

“For error shown below use process” ( from point 13 to point 19) 
For the constitution code 51, Enter Beneficial Owner Details in Relationship 
Tab,under Relationship type-‘Other Relationship’ 
Or introducer details 
13- Click on ‘relationship tab-> other relationship -> Add 
relationship
14- Select “cif type, entity type, user field 1” as applicable

15- Enter last name of owner then click on searcher, new page 
will open in that enter CIF id of owner/introducer, than click on 
submit

16- All the fields get auto fetch, select user field 1 as – 
beneficial owner, than click on save

17- CLICK ON SUBMIT 
MESSAGE WILL BE SHOWN AS ‘GENERAL SUBMITTED SUCCESSFULLY’ 
CLICK ON OK

18- NEW POP UP WILL APPEAR 
SELECT ‘SELECTED PROCESS NAME AS -> CIF CUSTOMER APPROVAL EDIT-
10.2” 
THEN CLICK ON ‘SAVE PROCESS SELECTION’

19- POP UP WILL APPEAR AS “PROCESS WAS SAVED SUCCESSFULLY”

20- IF USER CLICKED ON SAVE OPTION INSTEAD OF SUBMIT THEN THE 
CIF WILL MOVE TO HIS/HER SELF TRAY 
IN THIS CONDITION HE/SHE USED TO FOLLOW THE BELOW PATH 
 CIF CORPORATE-> ENTITY QUEUE-> ‘TRAY TYPE-> SELF’ -> ACTION-
> SAVED-> ENTER ENTITY ID (CIF)-> CLICK ON SUBMIT 
 CORPORATE ENTITY DETAILS WILL APPEAR 
 RIGHT CLICK ON CIF -> EDIT-> GENERAL DETAILS-> NOW CLICK ON 
SUBMIT

VERIFICATION OF CIF-> CIF IS IN SUBMIT STATUS 
21- VERIFYING USER FOLLOW THE PATH 
CIF CORPORATE-> ENTITY QUEUE-> ‘TRAY TYPE -> BUSINESS CENTER 
GROUP’ -> ACTION-> GENERAL BANKING-> ENTER ENTITY ID (CIF)-> 
CLICK ON GET

NOW THE CIF HAS BEEN MOVED TO SELF TRAY OF VERIFYING USER

CLICK ON OK

22- ‘CORPORATE ENTITY DETAILS’ WILL APPEAR

23- CLICK ON CIF ID

24- VISIT ALL PAGES ‘OR’ CHECK ALL DETAILS
THEN CLICK ON ‘CROSS- X’

25- CLICK ON ‘CURRENT PROCESS STEP’

26- CKICK ON LINK ‘CORPAPPROVE:-PROCESS TIME’

27- NEW PAGE WILL APPEAR AS ‘APPROVAL FORM’ 
SELECT DECESION AS ‘APPROVE’

CLICK ON SAVE APPROVAL FORM

28- NOW THE CIF IS VERIFIED SUCCESSFULLY

 NOW LINK THE CIF TO CORE SERVER BY MENU “HCCFM”

DELETION 
 If user want to cancel the modify cif or new cif which is in 
‘saved status’ 
“ENTITY QUEUE -> SELF TRAY “SELF” -> ACTION “SAVED” -> 
ENTITY ID (ENTER CIF ID) -> SUBMIT -> CLICK ON CHECK BOX-> 
RIGHT CLICK ON CIF -> ENTITY -> SELECT DELETE”

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

DCBBR 
[Consolidate Daily Cash Book]

1. Invoke the menu-DCBBR

2. Addition of DCBBR, Select the Function A-ADD then click on GO button.

3. Enter the appropriate denomination of each fields.

4. Enter Received today and Last Paid Today amount by generating report from HSCWRPTA

6. Enter correct value in Received Today and Paid Today

7. Click on Submit button

8. Select function V-Verify to Verify the DCBBR.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank

( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )
 DCSER 
 ADD 
 Invoke the menu –DCSER

 SELECT Function code : -A-ADD

 Enter the value in ‘Custom er id’ and ‘Account number’

 Select ‘option code’

 Click on ‘Fetch’ Than searcher available in ‘card number’

 Select ‘Card Number’ from searcher

 Select card number than click “Go’
 Select ‘Card status’ and ‘Remarks’
 Click on submit

Verify 
 Invoke the menu and select function V-Verify

 Enter the ‘cust id’ and ‘Account number’ and select ‘option code’ and click on ‘Fetch’

 Select card no from searcher

 Click GO

 Click on Subm it
C-Cancel

 Invoke the menu Select Function code C -Cancel

 Enter the ‘Cust id’ , ‘Account Num ber’ and select ‘option code ‘

 Click on ‘Fetch’

 Select Card number from searcher

 Click on ‘Go’
 Click on ‘Submit’

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank

( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

MENU- ETDSUPD & CHLDTL

* ETDSUPD - TO GENERATE SEQUENCE NO. 
1- INVOKE THE MENU - ETDSUPD 
2- SELECT TDS TYPE- FINACLE 
 OPTION CODE- GENERATE (FOR GENERATION OF SEQUENCE NO.) 
 OPTION CODE- DELETE (FOR DELETION OF SEQUENCE NO. BEFORE ‘CHLDTL’ MENU)

3- CLICK ON SUBMIT

4- VISIT ‘HPR’ MENU FOR PRINTING OF THE RECORDS

CHLDTL- TO TRANSFER TDS AMOUNT TO HO

1- SELECT FUNCTION A-ADD FUNCTION

2- CLICK ON GO

3- ENTER ‘FROM DATE AND TO DATE’ ( FROM DATE ‘START DATE OF PREVIOUS MONTH’ AND 
END DATE ‘LAST DATE OF PREVIOS MONTH’ )

4- CLICK ON ‘SEQ NUMBER’ SEARCHER

5- SELECT ‘NATURE OF PAYMENT- 94A’ AND ‘TYPE OF PAYMENT’-TDS/TCS PAYABLE BY TAX 
PAYER’ 
ENTER ‘TDS AMOUNT’ (TDS AMOUNT EQUAL TO ETDSUPD REPORT AMOUNT) 
ASSESSMENT YEAR SHOULD BE NEXT FINANCIAL YEAR IN THE FORMAT ‘YYYY-YY’

6- CLICK ON SUBMIT

NOW ‘VERIFY / MODIFY /INQUIRE’ THE RECORD 
7- SELECT FUNCTION ‘V-VERIFY / MODIFY / INQUIRE’ 
CLICK ON SEARCHER OF ‘REF NUMBER’

8- SELECT ‘REFERENCE NUMBER’ 
9- CLICK ON GO
10- CLICK ON SUBMIT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank

( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

FILETR AND HTTUM SOP

1- GENERATE THE ‘TXT’ FILE BY THE BULK UTILITY ( THE DATE FORMAT OF UTILITY AND SYSTEM 
SHOULD BE SAME AS ‘DD-MM-YYYY’) 
2- INVOKE THE MENU - FILETR

3- CLICK ON BROWSE..

4- GO TO FINACLEUPLOAD, SELECT THE FILE WHICH IS TO BE TRANSFER
5- CLICK ON UPLOAD

HTTUM 
1- INVOKE THE MENU - HTTUM 
 ENTER ‘REPORT TO’ FIELD – BM 
 SELECT TRANSACTION SUBTYPE – BANK INDUCED/CUSTOMER INDUCED 
 ACTION- FIRST USE ‘TRIAL’ MODE SO THAT IF ANY ERROR IS PRESENT WE CAN IDENTIFY 
IT AND CORRECT IT 
 IF TRIAL MODE DOES NOT HAVE ANY ERROR THAN USE ‘ACTION- ENTER / POST’ 
 SELECT ‘RENAME FILE AFTER UPLOAD’- NEVER 
 SELECT ‘FILE LOCATION - USER APPLICATION FILE PATH’ 
 ENTER ‘UPLOAD FILE NAME- (NAME OF THE FILE WHICH IS TRANSFERRED BY MENU 
FILETR) WITH .TXT EXTENSION’ 
 CLICK ON SUBMIT

TRIAL MODE

ENTER / POST

 AFTER SUCCESSFUL UPLOAD SYSTEM SHOW MESSAGE AS “BATCH PROGRAM 
SUCCESSFULLY INVOKED”

2- CHECK THE ‘HPR’ MENU FOR SUCCESS/FAILURE STATUS OF THE TRANSACTION

3- NOTE THE TRANSACTION NUMBER

4- INVOKE THE MENU ‘HTM’ 
 IF FILE IS UPLOADED AT ‘POST’ FUNCTION THEN SELECT FUNCTION V-VERIFY 
 IF FILE IS UPLOADED AT ‘ENTER’ FUNTION THEN SELECT FUNCTION M-MODIFY 
 ENTER THE TRANSACTION NO. IN ‘TRANSACTION ID’ FIELD 
 CLICK ON EXPAND 
 FIRST SELECT DEBIT A/C ID SRL NO. IN ‘PART TRANSACTION SRL. NO. FROM and TO’ 
FIELD ( IF DEBIT TRANSACTION ARE MORE THAN FOLLOW PROCESS OF POINT NO. 5)

 IF TRANSACTION A/C ID IS ‘OFFICE ACCOUNT’ THEN ENTER ‘1’ IN REF. NO. FIELD (BOTH 
CREDIT AND DEBIT OFFICE A/C)

 CLICK ON ‘PART BY POST TRANSACTION’ 
 CLICK ON ‘SELECT ALL PART TRANSACTIONS’ 
 CLICK ON SUBMIT

 SELECT ‘OVERRIDE EXCEPTIONS’ 
 CLICK ON ACCEPT

 DEBIT TRANSACTION GET POSTED

5- NOW ENTER CREDIT ACCOUNT SRL NO. RANGE IN ‘PART TRANSACTION SRL NO. FROM 
AND PART TRANSACTION SRL. NO.TO’ ( EG. THE TRANSACTION ID IS HAVING 300 RECORDS 
THEN FIRST TAKE ‘1 – 50’ RANGE, AFTER IT TAKE ‘51-100’ RANGE, THEN 101- 150, AND GO 
ON TILL LAST TRANSACTION )

6- CLICK ON GO

7- CLICK ON ‘POST BY PART TRANSACTION’

8- CLICK ON ‘SELECT ALL PART TRANSACTION’

9- SELECT ‘OVER RIDE EXCEPTIONS’ AS YES 
 CHECK ALL PAGES AND SELECT ALL ACCOUNT 
 NOTE- USER SHOULD NOT CLICK ON PROXY POST IF THEY SELECT THEN THAT 
TRANSACTION GOES AT PROXY LEVEL AT THAT A/C ID

10- CLICK ON ACCEPT

11- NOW FOLLOW THIS PATH FOR ANOTHER RANGE OF ACCOUNT’S TILL THE LAST 
TRANSACTION

FINACLE 10X MENU WITH JOBCARD

Soon our Core Banking System version is migrated from 
Finacle 7.0.25 to Finacle 10.2.18. I have Complied various Jobs 
card and one pager which is available in KRISH folder to one 
PDF. Details Jobs card are Just available at one Click/tap on 
menu/description. In this PDF page no from 2 to 4 are 
hyperlinks with content. This file can be also downloaded from 
Stardesk- discussion- Finacle 10x Complied booklet

URL for accessing Finacle 10.x is- 
 https://psms.starfina.boicorp.net:35500/SSO/ui
/SSOLogin.jsp

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to create CIF for Corporate Customers in the 
following categories – 
• Customer 
• Non Customer 
• Prospect 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Creation of CIF – Corporate (CRM)

At top right hand side select the Solution “CRM” through drop down. Click on the item 
‘CIF Corporate’ listed under the title “Functions” on the left side of screen Here click on 
the item “New Entity”, then select the item “Customer” from the list (enlisted on clicking 
the item New Entity.

CIF Corporate > New Entity > Customer

System to display the details under the “General”, sub-tab “Basic Info”.

CIF Corporate (CRM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 22 of 37

The Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) is an important development in U.S. 
efforts to improve tax compliance involving foreign financial assets and offshore 
accounts. Under FATCA, U.S. taxpayers with specified foreign financial assets that 
exceed certain thresholds which must be reported to the IR S about those assets. This 
reporting will be made on Form 8938, which taxpayers attach to their federal income tax 
return, starting 1st January 2013. In addition, FATCA will require foreign financial 
institutions to report directly to the IRS information about financial accounts held by U.S. 
taxpayers, or held by foreign entities in which U.S. taxpayers hold a substantial ownership 
interest. 
Finacle will provide facility to: 
i. Maintain various statuses at account level to facilitate the banks to track 
compliance 
ii. Withhold tax (Mark Lien as well as Collect Amt.) on customer accounts 
iii. Generate a report or data extract on statuses to facilitate compliance tracking 
activity

1. Overview 
Finacle is a customer centric solution. All products and services offered in Finacle are 
built around the customer. The first step in establishing a relationship with the customer 
is the creation of Customer Information File (CIF) where all the information about the 
customer is stored. This can be customer’s basic data, segmentation, product & services 
offered to customer, customer preferences, financial details, related parties, assets & 
liabilities, interests and hobbies and so on. The data relating to it are required various 
backend process. Instead of capturing these information in multiple back end systems, it 
is maintained at a common CIF database in Customer Relationship Management 
(CRM) module and linkage is provided to all the required backend systems. 
SCHEME TYPE: 
 Length: 3 characters 
 Types: 11 types of Scheme is available for Customers Accounts 
 06 types of Scheme is available for Office Accounts

SCHEME CODE: is a Product Code where parameter settings are been done. 
 Length : 05 characters. There is no limit of creation of number of Scheme 
 Codes. 
SET ID: this is a Logical set of Groups of SOL IDs. One SOL can be a part of so many 
 Logical Groups. 
SOL ID: Length: 08 characters 
BANK ID: 2 characters

OFFICE ACCOUNTS: 
• is meant For internal transactions 
• No CIF ID is required

FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS: All transactions like Cash/Transfer/Clearing 
NON-FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS: Issuance of Cheques, DD etc.

1. CRM: means Customer Relationship Management . It consists all 
customer related information. Hence, this is called Customer 
Information File (CIF). There are two types of CIF IDs: 
a. Retail Customers’ CIF ID: there are five entities under Retail 
i. Customer: Any person who are having account with our 
Bank. 
ii. Non Customer: walk-in customer 
iii. Contact: The person who are indirectly linked with our 
Bank and not having any account. It can be related party 
of customer (introducer, guarantor, Joint Holder, Letter of 
authority holder etc. 
The persons who are indirectly linked to the Bank and 
don’t have ACCOUNT Such as Guardians or Legal 
Guardian of a Minor, LOA (Letter of Authorization), POA 
(Power of Attorney), Executives of a Corporate Customer 
etc. 
iv. Lead: who shows interest to convert into a prospective 
customer.

CRM – CIF RETAIL Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 27

v. Prospect: from the business angle, Banks recognizes 
some affluent prospective persons and try to sell product 
or do business in future. To provide them efficient and 
good services, Bank may open a CIF ID (Customer ID) in 
advance. 
b. Corporate Customers’ CIF ID : there are three Entities under 
Corporate 
i. Customer 
ii. Non customer 
iii. Prospect

2. BOI-CORE: this is the main platform for all banking operations. 
3. After creation of CIF ID and linking it to BOICORE. All other banking 
operations are done from BOICORE. 
4. SVS: Signature Verifi cation System. This is related to signature, like 
capturing, modification, addition, deletion and verification of signatures. 
5. FI: this is financial integrator. Means interface between finacle and 
other applications 
6. RI : this is report infrastructure

All above activities are under SSO Admin means Single Sign On technology. In 
SSO, following functions can be done: 
1. Creation of users 
2. Defining roles of users 
3. Resources defining to users 
4. Change credentials 
Note: Creation of Dummy CIF for Welcome Kit Support. Upload Template for CIF Bulk 
Generation.

Creation of CIF – Maker – Two Options 
i) Save : allows Maker to modify the details 
ii) Submit: forwards the CIF for approval. Maker will not be able to 
modify 
Approval Process has a maximum of 9 steps 
1. DEDUP Check 
2. DEDUP Decision Making 
3. Blacklist Check 
4. Blacklist Decision Making 
5. Negative List 
6. Decision Making in Negative List 
7. Document Check 
8. Decision Making in Document Check 
9. Approval- Options Approve , Reject and Close 
• Approve – Verification of CIF 
• Reject – Return to Maker for modification 
• Close – Deletion of CIF without verification

Concept of Group Tray & Self Tray

CRM – CIF RETAIL Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 27

Self-Tray - Whenever CIF is created/saved/rejected by approver or submitted for 
approval by maker and assigned to self by checker, CIF appears in self-tray of the 
user i.e; the entities outstanding for logged in user’s action. 
Group-Tray – Any CIF is pending for approval it appears in the group tray. All 
users can access group-tray.

o CIF ID : 9 digit numeric 
o CIF ID can be created in three Modes under ‘New Entity’ 
1. DDE – Detailed Data Entry 
2. QDE- Quick Data Entry 
3. SQDE- Super Quick Data Entry

Logics OF CIF ID: 
• Unique and Numeric 
• One stop Shoppe of information 
• Segmentation like loan segment etc. 
• There is a provision to check duplicate customer IDs also, which is called 
DE duplication.

Interest Accrual for Accounts (HACACCR) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 5

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to calculate the interest accrual for accounts 
either through a batch process or on stand- alone basis. This menu is used manually 
when interest accrual is run outside of the batch, even for regular EOD interest accrual 
batch, a batch is created with regular running of the this menu.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Input for the Interest Accrual for Accounts (HACACCR)

On invocation of the menu, t he User has to enter valid values for the field ‘Set ID’, 
‘Report To’, ‘From Date’ and ‘To Date’ is auto- populated with the current BOD Date as 
the default value. 
The interest accrual can be done for one or for a given set of continuous Account 
Numbers, or for one or for a gi ven set of continuous GL Sub Head Codes, or one or for 
a given set of continuous Scheme Codes or even for a selected Scheme Type. 
Certain mandatory radio buttons are to be clicked before the actual interest accrual is 
submitted by the User. These radio buttons are: 
Field Name (with radio buttons) Default Value 
Debit/ Credit Interest Credit Interest Only 
Ad Hoc Mode Recalculate interest if necessary 
Print Interest Details Print Detailed Report 
Closed A/c. Exclude 
NPA A/c. Include 
Disabled A/c. Exclude 
Dormant A/c. Include 
Frozen A/c. Include

The value for the field ‘Transaction Value Date’ will get auto-populated with the current 
BOD Date and this field is protected. User, may click on SUBMIT button to execute the 
Interest Accrual operation based on the above stated inputs.

Interest Booking for Accounts (HACBOOK) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 5

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to book interest on accounts either 
through a batch process or on stand- alone basis. This menu is used manually 
when interest is applied outside of the batch; even the batch created for actual 
interest booking has this menu. 
.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Input for the Interest Booking for Accounts (HACBOOK)

On invocation of the menu, the User has to enter valid values for the field ‘Set ID’, 
‘Report To’. The User may key-in the date for the field ‘From Date’ (else, the system will 
start booking from the l ast booked date. The field ‘To Date’ is mandatory, which gets 
auto-populated with the current BOD Date as the default value. 
The interest booking can be done for one or for a given set of continuous Account 
Numbers, or for one or for a given set of continuous GL Sub Head Codes, or for one or 
for a given set of continuous Scheme Codes or for one or for a given set of continuous 
CIF Ids. or even for a selected Scheme Type. The value for the field ‘Transaction Value 
Date’ will get auto-populated with the current BOD Date. 
Certain mandatory radio buttons are to be clicked before the actual interest booking is 
submitted by the User. These radio buttons are:

Field Name (with radio buttons) Default Value 
Post Transaction No 
Frequency Based Interest Run No 
Debit / Credit Interest Credit Interest Only 
Ad Hoc Mode Recalculate interest if necessary 
Print Interest Details Print Detailed Report 
Closed A/c. Exclude 
NPA A/c. Exclude 
Disabled A/c. Exclude 
Dormant A/c. Include 
Frozen A/c. Include 
Print Interest Advices None

User, may click on SUBMIT button to execute the Interest Application operation based 
on the above stated inputs.

Power, Lien Amount etc.

helps the Bank to access the earnings and expenditure that the Bank earned or 
incurred on the selected Account.

account number, whose details the User wishes to view. On clicking the ‘GO’ button, 
the system displays the details of the selected account. Details relating to the Customer 
of the selected account, Scheme and linked GL Sub Head Code details, Account

the selected account. Withdrawals permitted for the account.

paid to the account (this will fetch the inform ation on earnings and expenditure of the 
selected account). This page also displays the details relating to ECS repayment.

Inquiry option.

2.1 Customer Accounts Inquiry (HACI)

The User has to enter or select the Account Number for the mandatory field ‘A/c. ID’, 
whose details are to be fetched by the system. The field Function will get auto-
populated with the value ‘I-Inquire’ and the field remains protected.

2.2 Customer Accounts Inquiry – General Detail tab

This is the default page, which the system displays to the user as soon as the ‘GO’ 
button is pressed at the criteria page. This page displays the Account Short Name, 
Account Open Date, Mode of Operations etc.

Customer Accounts Inquiry (HACI) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 13

2.3 Customer Accounts Inquiry – Interest & Tax tab

This tab displays the details of the Interest is to be paid or collected or both for the said 
account. The percentage of Interest paid / collected. The debit and credit interest A/c. 
are also displayed through this tab. Even the Penal Interest details and Tax Details are 
also displayed through this Tab.

Customer Accounts Inquiry (HACI) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 13

2.4 Customer Accounts Inquiry – Scheme tab

This tab displays the details of the Scheme Code under which the selected account is 
created. The tab indicates whether the minimum balance to be maintained by the said 
account should be determined as the Scheme of this account or its set exclusively for 
this account only . If the selected acc ount is linked with Flexi Fixed Deposit, then what 
would be the Sweep in Balance and the Min. Balance for which the account is being 
maintained?

When the selected account is held jointly, this tab displays the details of other parties, 
who are joint holders of this account. One of the holders will be the Main Holder, while

and all other Joint Holders will be described under this tab.

Interest Run for Accounts (HACINT) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 5

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to apply the interest accounts either through 
a batch process or on stand- alone basis. This menu is used manually when interest is 
applied outside of the batch, even the batch created for actual interest application has 
this menu.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Input for the Interest Run for Accounts (HACINT)

On invocation of the menu, t he User has to enter valid values for the field ‘Set ID’, 
‘Report To’, ‘From Date’ and ‘To Date’ is auto- populated with the current BOD Date as 
the default value. 
The interest a pplication can be done for one or for a given set of continuous Account 
Numbers, or for one or for a given set of continuous GL Sub Head Codes, or for one or 
for a given set of continuous Scheme Codes or for one or for a given set of continuous 
CIF Ids. or even for a selected Scheme Type. The value for the field ‘Transaction Value 
Date’ will get auto-populated with the current BOD Date. 
Certain mandatory radio buttons are to be clicked before the actual interest accrual is 
submitted by the User. These radio buttons are:

Field Name (with radio buttons) Default Value 
Post Transaction No 
Frequency Based Interest Run No 
Debit / Credit Interest Credit Interest Only 
Ad Hoc Mode Recalculate interest if necessary 
Print Interest Details Print Detailed Report 
Closed A/c. Exclude 
NPA A/c. Include 
Disabled A/c. Exclude 
Dormant A/c. Include 
Frozen A/c. Include 
Print Interest Advices No

User, may click on SUBMIT button to execute the Interest Application operation based 
on the above stated inputs.

Interest Run for Accounts (HACINT) Job Card

Report on 
HACINT.pdf

Customer Account Ledger Print: Print the ledger for an Account or a range of Accounts 
according to the options selected in – Criteria Page.

chosen by user.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Options 
1. Report To field is mandatory- Type the name of the person to whom 
the report is to be addressed. 
2. Set ID field is mandatory - Select or type the ID of the service outlet 
set to which the branch belongs. 
3. GL Sub Head Code- Optional field - Select or type the valid GL 
Subhead code for which the report is to be generated. 
4. A/c. ID From - Optional field - Select or type the account number 
from which the report is to be generated. 
5. A/c. ID To - Optional field - Select or type the account number up to 
which the report is to be generated. 
6. CCY- Optional field - Select or type the currency code in which the 
accrual of interest report is to be generated. 
7. A/c. Label - Optional field - Select or type the account label code to 
be associated with the accounts to be selected for report generation.

8. Criteria/Options Available 
i) Open/Closed A/c.- Click the appropriate option button to indicate if 
open/closed/both accounts should be included in the report. (Both is the 
default value and can be modified.) 
ii) Period – From & To - Select or type the range of dates for which the 
report is to be generated. 
iii) Order by General Ledger Date – Click the appropriate option button to 
indicate if the report should be in the order of the transaction date. 
iv) Limits Details Reqd.- Click the appropriate option button to indicate if 
the report should display the limit details for the account
.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Options 
1. SOL / Set ID – Optional field - Select or type the code of the service outlet 
from which you want to view a list of accounts.

the accounts that you want to view.

corresponding to the GL Subhead under which the accounts you want to 
view are opened. 
5. CIF ID - Optional field - Select or type the CIF ID of the customer whose 
accounts you want to view. 
6. Employee ID – Optional field - Select or type the employee ID of the 
customer, if the customer is an employee of the bank. 
7. A/c. Manager ID – Optional Field - Select or type the ID of the user 
managing the accounts that you want to view. 
8. Freeze Code – Option field – Select –T-Total freeze/C-Credit Only/D-Debit 
only. 
9. Freeze Reason Code (1-5)-Optional Field - Select or type the

– Select –T-Total freeze/C-Credit Only/D-Debit 
only.

reason for which accounts have been frozen.

the accounts. This code is used to categorize accounts belonging to a 
location. 
11. Purpose of Advance –Optional field- Select or type the code for the purpose 
of advance. 
12. Nature of Advance – Optional field- Select or type the code for the nature of 
advance given to accounts. 
13. Guarantee Cover Code – Optional field - Select or type the code of the 
guarantee cover. 
14. Occupation Code – Optional field- Select or type the occupation code of 
the customer. 
15. Sector Code – Optional field- Select or type the sector code of the customer. 
16. Subsector Code - Optional field - Select or type the subsector code of the 
customer.

Modify 
1. Enter or select (through dropdown) a value for the mandatory field ‘Function’ 
2. Enter or select (through searcher) a value for the mandatory field ‘A/c ID’ 
3. Select or type a value for the optional field ‘Advance Status’ (status of the TOD). 
(Valid values- Expired/Future Dated/Interest Collected/ Regularized/Not 
regularized). 
4. Select or type the date from which the records are to be selected for modification. 
5. Select or type the date up to which the records are to be selected for 
modification. 
6. Click on GO. (System will navigate the user to details page) 
7. Click on Add New Record. Enter the required fields. 
8. Click on Submit. System will display the result message.

 Print DR/CR Advice to Customer

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
optinos 
1. Select or type the service outlet of the customer in ‘SOL ID’ field. 
2. Select from the drop-down list, the account owner code in ‘A/c Ownership’ 
field. 
3. Select /enter the code of the currency of the account/s in “CCY’ field. 
4. Select/enter the range of customers for whom vouchers are to be printed in 
‘From CIF ID’ & ‘To CIF ID’ fields. 
5. Select the ‘Transaction Type’ from the drop-down list. 
6. Select/enter the range of accounts for which vouchers are to be printed in 
‘From A/c ID’ & ‘To A/c ID’ fields. 
7. Select the part transaction type from the drop-down list-Cr/Dr/Both. 
8. Select/Enter the range of dates- Date From /To. The transactions of the 
range of dates will be retrived. 
9. Enter the transaction ID in ‘Tran. ID’ field. 
10. Specify the range of amounts in ‘Amt. From/To’ field. The transactions 
falling within this range of amounts are displayed. 
11. Check ‘Advice Printing’ radio button to print advice OR Check ‘Voucher 
Printing’ radio button to print vouchers.
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will display the results as per chosen criteria)

Cash Deposit (HCASHDEP) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 13

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to deposit Cash in the permitted accounts of 
customer. This menu also allows cross currency deposits (e.g. a customer deposits 
foreign currency into his/her INR A/c.). In cross currency transactions the system is 
capable of passing entries relating to Position A/c.s.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Cash Deposit – Add (HCASHDEP)

On invocation of the menu “HCASHDEP”, select ‘A-Add’ from the drop down. Select a 
valid value (e.g. ‘C/NR – Cash/Normal Receipt’) for the field ‘Transaction Type/ Sub Type. 
Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to the General page; the radio button for the field ‘Part 
Transaction Type’ will be default selected as ‘Credit’ and will be protected. Enter or select 
(through searcher) the A/c. ID. 
Based on the A/c. ID the Ref. CCY will get auto-populated (but editable) and enter the 
amount of deposit. For cross currency transactions Rate Code and Rates are mandatory. 
User can enter text for the field ‘Transaction Particulars’ and also select a value for the 
field ‘Transaction Particular Code’. 
User can enter data for any other field that the user finds it important. System to display 
the A/c. ID information relating to ‘Ledger Balance’, ‘Available Balance’, ‘Effective 
Available Balance’, ‘Shadow Balance’ ‘A/c. Status’, ‘Mode of Operation’, ‘Customer 
Status’ etc. 
The system provides the user for entering details on ‘Additional Part Tran Details’, 
‘Partitioning Details’, ‘

s’ etc. 
The system provides the user for entering details on ‘Additional Part Tran Details’, 
‘Partitioning Details’, ‘User Additional Details’, ‘Release Lien Details’, Miscellaneous 
Details’ etc. 
Click on the button ‘ SAVE’, to save the data on cash deposit . Even the user can POST 
the data, wherein, system will not only save the data, but also post the transaction. 
System to generate the message – “Transaction ID <<Tran ID / Tran Date >> added 
successfully”; on successful saving of the cash deposit transaction.

Cash Deposit (HCASHDEP) Job Card

On invocation of the menu “HCASHDEP”, select ‘M – Modify’ from the drop down. Enter 
a valid Tran ID whose existing values are to be modified. But the Tran should be in 
‘Entered’ status else, it can’t be modified. 
Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to the General page; where all the existing values 
pertaining to the entered Tran ID will be displayed in editable mode, the user as per 
requirement execute the modification. Even the user may add values to certain blank 
optional fields or even delete existing values of certain optional fields and let that field 
remain empty. 
The system provides the user for entering detai ls on ‘Additional Part Tran Details’, 
‘Partitioning Details’, ‘User Additional Details’, ‘Release Lien Details’, Miscellaneous 
Details’ etc.

successfully”; on successful modification of an existing cash deposit transaction

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 9

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to do maintenance related events (activities) 
of issued cheque books to Account Ids. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Inquiry of cheque book already issued to an account.

On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘I -Issue’ through drop down for 
the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id ( to whom cheques 
have been issued). Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of cheque 
books issued to the selected Account Id. 
Select one of the listed Cheque Books and click on the icon under the column ‘View 
Details’. On clicking this icon, system disp lays the status of each cheque leaf of the 
selected Cheque Book.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 9

2.2 Marking ‘Caution’ to a cheque leaf. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘C -Caution’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id (to whom 
cheques have been issued). Key -in a valid Cheque leaf Id. (it should be issued to this 
selected Account Id) for the field ‘Begin Cheque No.’. Enter the number of cheque 
leaves to be cautioned for the field ‘No. of Leaves’ (consecutives number of leaves 
including the begin cheque number leaf will be cautioned). Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become cautioned.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 9

2.3 ‘Destroy’ a cheque leaf. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘D -Destroy’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id (to whom 
cheques have been issued). Key -in a valid Cheque leaf Id. (it should be issued to this 
selected Account Id) for the field ‘Begin Cheque No.’. Enter th e number of cheque 
leaves to be destroyed for the field ‘No. of Leaves’ (consecutives number of leaves 
including the begin cheque number leaf will be destroyed). Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become destroyed.

2.4 Verify the cheque leaf after marking Caution. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘V -Verify’ through drop down for 
the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the A/c. Id (whose cheque leaf(s) 
have been marked with Caution). Key -in the Cheque leaf Id. (which is to be verified 
after being marked with Caution).

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 9

Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become cautioned.

2.5 Undo of cheque leaf(s) after marking Caution. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘U -Undo’ through drop down for 
the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the A/c. Id (whose cheque l eaf(s) 
is marked with Caution). Key-in the Cheque leaf Id. (which is to be undone from marked 
with Caution). Key -in value for the field ‘No. of Leaves’ (which are to be undone, e.g. 
suppose 2 consecutive leaves are marked for Caution, but only 1 can be done Undo. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become Unused.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 8 of 9

INQUIRY MADE AFTER MARKING CAUTION

INQUIRY MADE AFTER UNDO

Issue Cheque Book (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 9 of 9

2.6 Cancel the marking a leaf as Cautioned. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM”, select the value ‘X-Cancel’ through drop down for 
the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the A/c. Id (whose cheque leaf(s) 
is marked with Caution). Key-in the Cheque leaf Id. (which is to be cancelled from 
marked with Caution) for the field ‘Begin Cheque No.’. Click on GO.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHBAU) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 9

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to do maintenance related events (activities) 
of issued cheque books to Account Ids. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Inquiry of cheque book already issued to an account.

On invocation of the menu “HCHBMAU”, select the value ‘I -Issue’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id ( to whom 
cheques have been issued). Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of cheque 
books issued to the selected Account Id. 
Select one of the listed Cheque Books and click on the icon under the column ‘View 
Details’. On clicking this icon, system disp lays the status of each cheque leaf of the 
selected Cheque Book.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHBAU) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 9

2.2 Marking ‘Caution’ to a cheque leaf. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM AU”, select the value ‘C -Caution’ through drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id (to whom 
cheques have been issued). Key -in a valid Cheque leaf Id. (it should be issued to this 
selected Account Id) for the field ‘Begin Cheque No.’. Enter th e number of cheque 
leaves to be cautioned for the field ‘No. of Leaves’ (consecutives number of leaves 
including the begin cheque number leaf will be cautioned). Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become cautioned.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHBAU) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 9

2.3 ‘Destroy’ a cheque leaf. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM AU”, select the value ‘D -Destroy’ through drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) a valid A/c. Id (to whom 
cheques have been issued). Key -in a valid Cheque leaf Id. (it should be issued to this 
selected Account Id) for the field ‘ Begin Cheque No.’. Enter the number of cheque 
leaves to be destroyed for the field ‘No. of Leaves’ (consecutives number of leaves 
including the begin cheque number leaf will be destroyed). Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become destroyed.

2.4 Verify the cheque leaf after marking Caution. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM AU”, select the value ‘V -Verify’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the A/c. Id (whose cheque 
leaf(s) have been marked with Caution). Key -in the Cheque leaf Id. (which is to be 
verified after being marked with Caution). 
Click on GO.

Issue Cheque Book (HICHBAU) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 9

System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become cautioned.

2.5 Undo of cheque leaf(s) after marking Caution. 
On invocation of the menu “HCHBM AU”, select the value ‘U -Undo’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the A/c. Id (whose cheque 
leaf(s) is marked with Caution). Key -in the Cheque leaf Id. (which is to be undone from 
marked with Caution). Key -in value for the field ‘No. of Leav es’ (which are to be 
undone, e.g. suppose 2 consecutive leaves are marked for Caution, but only 1 can be 
done Undo. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details of the cheque 
leaf(s) with their Cheque No., Current Status and New Status. Click on SUBMIT. 
On Submission, the statuses all the selected cheques leaf(s) will become Unused.

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 9

1. Overview 
This menu is about Collateral Linkage Maintenance

2. Business Flow

The menu HCLM has 6 Functions, which are as follows:

2.1 Lodge (HCLM L-Lodge)

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
L - Lodge 
1. Invoke the menu HCLM (System navigate the Criteria page) 
2. Select the value 'L-Lodge' (through drop down) for the mandatory field 
'Function'; 
3.Select or type a valid value for the collateral type 
valid values are: B-Book Debts, 
C-Cheques and Receivables, D-Deposits, E-Consumer Durable, G- Government 
Securities, I-Immovable Property, J-Gold/Jewellery, L-Live Stock, M-Machineries, 
N-Small Savings Certificate, O-Others, P-Life Insurance, Q-QIS Statement, S-
Tradable Securities, T-Stock, U-Mutual Funds-Units, V-Vehicles, X-Transaction 
Accounts, R - Guarantee 
4.Click on to Go (System will navigate the user to details page) 
5.On detail page ,Provide the Collateral Code 
Note: The collateral code currency must be the same as the node/ account 
currency. 
6. Provide the Ceiling Limit (Amount): Type the amount beyond which the collateral 
cannot contribute to Drawing Power 
7.Select or type the last valuation date for collaterals other than those belonging to 
deposit types. This valuation date is used to arrive at the di

ation date for collaterals other than those belonging to 
deposit types. This valuation date is used to arrive at the discounting percentage 
for a collateral's effective value depending on the type of collateral and principle 
outstanding in the asset entity. 
Note: 
# By default, the BOD date is displayed. This value cannot be greater than BOD. 
# If the Collateral Code is D-Deposits, this field is disabled. 
# If this field is not entered, the time when the record was last modified is 
considered as the last valuation date. 
8.Enter the Collateral Value :The total value of the collateral 
9.After providing all mandatory inputs click on to submit button

Create and Update Reversal Transaction(HCRT) Job Card

Classification: Internal 
Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to reverse an existing transaction which is 
already verified.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Reversal of an existing transaction (HCRT)

On invocation of the menu, t he User has to select the value “R -Request” from the drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. System will auto -populate the BOD Date as the default 
value for the field ‘Transaction Date. En ter the Transaction Id. that has to be reversed. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the User to the details page, where the part Tran. Id to be selected 
(whose A/c. Id. has to be reversed). Enter the new (correct) A/c. Id in the field 
‘Rectification A/c. Id’. Click on SUBMIT. 
System will display the success message “Transaction reversal request done 
successfully. Ref. No. <<Ref. Id.>>

Create and Update Reversal Transaction(HCRT) Job Card

Classification: Internal 
Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

2.2 Cancelling the reversal of an existing transaction (HCRT)

On invocation of the menu, the User has to select the value “X -Cancel” from the drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. System will auto- populate the BOD Date as the default 
value for the field ‘Transaction Date. Enter the Transaction Id whose reversal has to be 
cancelled. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the User to the details page, and display the existing values of the 
fields of this screen. Click on SUBMIT. 
System will display the success message “Transaction reversal request cancelled 
successfully”.

2.3 Verifying the reversal of an existing transaction (HCRT)

On invocation of the menu, the User has to select the value “V -Verify” from the drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. System will auto- populate the BOD Date as the default 
value for the field ‘Transaction Date. Enter the Transaction Id. whose reversal has to be 
verified. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the User to the details page, and display the existing values of the 
fields of this screen. Click on SUBMIT.

Create and Update Reversal Transaction(HCRT) Job Card

Classification: Internal 
Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 6

System will display the success message “Transactions are reversed successfully. 
Reversal Transaction ID <<Transaction ID>>”.

END OF DOCUMENT

Changing Service Outlet for Employee (HCSE) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 4

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to change the existing SOL of an employee. 
Meaning when any Bank Employee is transferred from one branch to another, his/her 
linked SOL Id. can be changed.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Changing Service Outlet for Employee (HCSE)

On invocation of the menu, t he User has to select the value “ M-Modify” from the drop 
down for the field ‘Function’. Enter the “Employee Id.” of the User in the field ‘Employee 
ID’. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the User to the details page, Enter the SOL Id. in the field ‘To SOL 
ID’ where Employee Id has to be transferred. (this entered value and the auto-
populated value for the protected field ‘From SOL ID’ has to be different). Enter or 
select (through searcher) a valid value for the field ‘Authoriser ID’ (this value has to be 
different from the User ID who is executing this SOL Id change as well as whose SOL 
Id is being changed. Click on SUBMIT. 
System will display a success message on change of Service Outlet (SOL Id.) of an 
employee.

END OF DOCUMENT

DD Cancellation Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
 DD Cancellation - A draft or banker cheque after issue can either be paid in the normal course 
or cancelled by the purchaser when the original instrument is produced and a refund is demanded. 
The cancellation can be done at the issuing branch or at any other branch. The bank can colle ct 
charges at the time of cancellation. 
2. Business Flow

The HDDC menu option is used for cancellation of Draft or Bankers Cheque. It has 2 
functions C-Cancel/P-Post.

2.1 C-Cancel 
Function Navigation of the Selected Function

C-Cancel 
1. Select the value for ‘Non System DD ‘ field to indicate if you are cancelling 
a non-system DD. 
2. Select from the drop -down the code of the function to be performed (C -
Cancel/P-Post). 
3. Type the ID of the DD transaction to be cancelled or posted in ‘Tran. ID’ 
field (Field is mandatory for posting a transaction). 
4. Type the DD number that must be cancelled in ‘DD number’ field. 
5. Select or type the date on which the DD was issued in ‘ DD Issue Date’ – 
mandatory field. 
6. Select or type the type of service charge transactions to be created in ‘Tran. 
Type’ mandatory field. 
7. Select or type the report code for the DD account in ‘Report Code’ field. 
Entry in this field is mandatory if you need to post the transaction. 
8. Type the reference number used to identify the DD transaction in ‘Ref. No.’ 
field. Entry in this field is mandatory if you need to post the transaction. 
9. Type the DD amount and the currency in which the DD was issued in ‘DD 
Amt.’ Field. 
10. Select or type the codes of the issuing bank, branch and extension counter in 
‘Issued By’ fiel

n ‘DD 
Amt.’ Field. 
10. Select or type the codes of the issuing bank, branch and extension counter in 
‘Issued By’ field. 
11. Select or type the value date for future transaction in ‘Value Date’ mandatory 
field. 
12. Type the DD account number in ‘DD A/c. ID’ field. 
13. Select the value to create fee transactions in ‘Create Fee Tran.’ Field Yes/No. 
 Click on ‘GO’. (System will display details in 2nd screen) 
 Click on ‘SUBMIT’.

DD Cancellation Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

DD Cancellation Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 6

2.2 P-Post 
Function Navigation of the Selected Function

P-Post 
1. Select the value for ‘Non System DD ’ field to indicate if you are cancelling 
a non-system DD. 
2. Select from the drop -down the code of the function to be performed (C -
Cancel/P-Post). 
3. Type the ID of the DD transaction to be cancelled or posted in ‘Tran. ID’ 
field (Field is mandatory for posting a transaction). 
4. Type the DD number that must be cancelled in ‘DD number’ field. 
5. Select or type the date on which the DD was issued in ‘DD Issue Date’ – 
mandatory field.

1. Overview 
 DD Report Printing – Generation of various reports pertaining to DD such as DD 
Issued Summary, DD Issued Register, DD Paid Summary, DD Paid Register, DD 
Cancellation and Rectification Summary, DD Cancellation and Rectification Register, 
DD Consolidated Summary etc.

2. Business Flow 
The HDDP menu option is used to generate All Summaries and Registers of DD.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Options 
1. Enter the name of the person to whom the report should be 
addressed to in Mandatory field ‘Report To’. 
2. Enter/Select the ID of the service outlet in Mandatory field ‘SOL Set 
ID’ for which the report should be printed. 
3. Enter / Select the currency of the DD transactions to be included in 
the report in Mandatory field ‘CCY’. 
4. Enter the date from which the records should be retrieved in the field 
‘From Date’. 
5. Enter the date up to which, the records should be retrieved in the 
field ‘To Date’. 
6. Click the appropriate Box to select ‘Demand Draft Type’. 
7. Click on ‘Check box’ for the field ‘All DDs Printed’ to enable, if only 
printed DD records are to be retrieved. 
8. Select a value from the drop down for the field ‘Report to be Printed’ 
to generate the type of report.

Distribution of Deposits by Flow Amt. Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 5

1. Overview 
This menu is to generate a report of deposits accounts based on to Flow amount

2. Business Flow

2.1 Generating report (HFDD)

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Option 
1. Invoke the menu HFDD (System navigate the Criteria page) 
2.Enter the valid value for field Report To :Type the person to whom the report is to 
be addressed 
3.Enter of select the valid value for field Sol id :A default value is displayed and can 
be modified 
4.Min. Flow Amt :Type the minimum amount of a flow based on which the deposits 
are to be selected. All deposits which have a flow equal to or greater than this 
amount is selected 
5.Flow Start Date: Select or type the date from which the records are to be 
retrieved. 
6. Flow End Date: Select or type the date from which the records are to be 
retrieved 
7.Mrt File Name: Select or type the name of the MRT file to be used to generate 
the report. The file name must be the same as that specified using the ROTM 
menu option 
8.Click on to submit button(system will display the success massage on result

Issue Cheque Books (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Issue Books. Any User (even not 
holding the Cheque Book inventory in his / her location code. The User can issue 
Cheque Books from any other employee’s location code. 
.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Issuance of Cheque Books (HICHB)

On invocation of the menu, select the value ‘I -ISSUE’ through dropdown for the field 
‘Function’. 
Enter or select the A/c. Id., where the cheque book has to be issued. 
System will auto -populate the BOD date as the default value for the field ‘Issue Date’. 
Click the radio button ‘No’ for the field ‘Acknowledgement Obtained’, when the 
acknowledgement is not required from A/c. Id. (after the A/c. holder receives the issued 
cheque book). 
Enter or select (through searcher) Employee Number for the field ‘Cheque With’, who 
holds the Cheque Book inventory. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the detailed page, where details of the all cheque book 
inventory that the entered/ selected Employee holds. 
Check that record(s) of Cheque Book inventory which is being issued to the selected 
A/c. Id. Click on SUBMIT. 
On submission, success message stating – ‘Selected cheque books issued 
successfully to A/c. ID – << A/c. Id.>>’ will be displayed on the screen.

Issue Cheque Books (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

2.2 Verification of issuance of Cheque Books (HICHB)

On invocation of the menu, select the value ‘V -VERIFY’ through dropdown for the field 
‘Function’. Enter or select the A/c. Id., where the cheque book (s) is issued and awaiting 
verification. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the detailed page, where the existing values towards 
issuance of cheque book to the selected A/c. Id. will be displayed. Click on SUBMIT. 
On submission, success message stating – ‘Cheque Books Issue for A/c. ID – << A/c. 
Id.>> verified successfully’ will be displayed on the screen.

Issue Cheque Books (HICHB) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 6

2.3 Cancellation of issuance of Cheque Books (HICHB)

On invocation of the menu, select the value ‘ X-Cancel’ through dropdown for the field 
‘Function’. Enter or select the A/c. Id., where the cheque book is issued and is being 
cancelled. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the detailed page, where the existing values towards 
issuance of cheque book to the selected A/c. Id. will be displayed. Click on SUBMIT. 
On submission, success message stating – ‘Cheque Books Issue for A/c. ID – << A/c. 
Id.>>. Cancelled successfully’ will be displayed on the screen.

END OF DOCUMENT

The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Issue Book(s) to Account Ids. The 
User executing this operation should have the Cheque Book inventory in his / her 
location code (i.e. EM <<Location Class>> & Emp. No. <<Location Code>>). 
.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Issuance of Cheque Book to a particular A/c. Id. (HICHBA)

On invocation of the menu, select the value ‘I -ISSUE’ through dropdown for the field 
‘Function’. 
Enter or select the A/c. Id., where the cheque book has to be issued. 
System will auto -populate the BOD date as the de fault value for the field ‘Issue Date’. 
Click the radio button ‘No’ for the field ‘Acknowledgement Obtained’, when the 
acknowledgement is not required from A/c. Id. (after the A/c. holder receives the issued 
cheque book). 
Enter value for the fields ‘Begin Chq. No.’, ‘No. of Chq. Leaves’, ‘Leaves per Book’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the detailed page, where details of the cheque book 
that is being issued to the selected A/c. Id. will be displayed. Click on SUBMIT. 
On submission, success message stating – ‘Selected cheque books issued 
successfully to A/c. ID – << A/c. Id.>>’ will be displayed on the screen.

‘Report To’, ‘CCY (Currency Code)’ and select ‘Credit’ from the drop down.

field Despatch Mode.

These radio buttons are:

Interest Proof Report (HINTPRF) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 4

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to generate a report which is on interest 
proof on deposit accounts. 
.

2. Business Flow 
2.1 Interest Proof Report (HINTPRF)

On invocation of the menu, the User has to enter a valid A/c. Id. whose Interest Proof 
report has to be generated. System will fetch the SOL Id. of the account through the 
entered A/c. Id. The default value for the field radio button field ‘Credit/Debit In dicator’ 
will be ‘Credit Interest Only’. Enter or select (through date picker) a valid date for the

in verify mode. It has 4 Functions, which are as follows:

2.1 S - Payment

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
S - 
Payment

1. Select or type the appropriate value for mandatory field ‘ Payment Type ’ to 
select a payment type from dropdown. 
2. Click the appropriate value to select a transaction type – C-Cash/T-Transfer. 
3. Click the appropriate value for field ‘Debit From’ to select the account which 
must be debited for the payment amount. Valid Values are Operative A/c. 
/Common Dr. A/c. Field is Mandatory for Transaction Type –Transfer. 
4. Click on ‘GO’. System will display the Detail page. 
5. Enter/Select the Loan A/c ID to be credited in mandatory field ‘Loan A/c ID’. 
6. Enter amount of schedule payment in ‘Credit Amount’ field. 
7. Click on ‘Accept’. System will display the details. 
8. Click on ‘SUBMIT’. System will display the result page.

1. Overview 
Limit Node Maintenance – Banks need to keep a track of the total exposure towards a 
Customer. In finacle using Limit Node the Total Drawing Power of a customer across 
accounts and other liabilities can be very well monitored. A customer may have multiple 
Overdraft accounts, Bills, Bank Guarantee and loan accounts with a Bank, by using 
Limit Nodes the overall liability of a customer can be monitored. 
2. Business Flow

The menu option HLNM is used for Limit Node Maintenance. It has 9 Functions, which 
are as follows:

2.1 A-Add 
2.1.1 Criteria Page

Criteria 
Page 
1. Enter or select (through dropdown) A-Add for the mandatory field 
‘Function’. 
2. Enter a value in the mandatory field ‘Limit ID’. This field consists of two 
parts, the prefix and suffix for the Limit ID. The prefix is user definable. 
List is available for the suffix through search button. 
3. Click on GO. (System will navigate the user to details page – 
LNMDetails ).

Currency of the child node should be the same as the currency of the 
parent node. 
3. Limit Type – co-mandatory field – select from drop down the type of 
limit applicable for the Limit ID. 
4. Limit Type ID - co-mandatory field – Enter the ID of the customer or 
account to whom the limit is applicable. 
5. Approval Limit-Mandatory field – Enter the amount approved as the 
limit for the limit node. 
6. Drawing Power Ind. – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown a value 
to indicate the drawing power computation. 
7. Limit Approval Date- Mandatory field – Enter the sanction date of limits 
at this node level. 
8. Master Limit Node-mandatory field – Select or type the master limit code. 
9. Limit Activation Conditions Precedent Met – mandatory field – Click the 
appropriate value to indicate if the limit activation conditions precedent 
met. Valid values are – Yes/No.

propriate value to indicate if the limit activation conditions precedent

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 16

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to have a complete control over Outward 
Clearing (Paper Based instruments) of a Bank. It starts from Opening of an Outward 
Clearing Zone to the Regularization (auto-closure) of that zone. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Open Zone (HMCLZOH)

On invocation of the menu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘ O-Open Zone’ from the drop down, 
enter or select (through searcher) an appropriate Zone Date/Code.. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the General Details page; the user needs to enter valid 
office A/c. s for the fields – ‘Debit A/c. ID’ and ‘Interclearing A/c. ID’. As per requirement 
the user may key-in data for other optional fields. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Zone - <<SOL ID>> <<Zone Date/ Zone Code>> 
Opened successfully”; on successful opening of an Outward Clearing Zone.

The User may use the menu option “HOCTM” for lodgement of instruments:

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 16

2.2 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Copy a Zone (HMCLZOH)

On invocation of the menu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘ C-Copy Zone’ from the drop down, 
enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/Code (where entered 
instruments are already there). 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page, wherein, the selected zone will be the 
“Transfer from Zone’, enter values for the fields ‘From Set No.’ and ‘To Set No.’. Under 
the broad heading “Transfer to Zone” enter or select (through searcher) the Zone Date 
/Code (the status of this zone should be ‘Open’). 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Batch Program successfully invoked” ; on 
successful copying of instruments from zone to another zone.

User should access the menu ‘HPR’ and view the report on “ OUTWARD CLEARING 
COPY ZONE REPORT”

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 16

HMCLZOH - 
CO PY. p d f

2.3 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Transfer of Sets (HMCLZOH)

On invocation of the menu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘T – Transfer of Sets ’ from the drop 
down, enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/Code (where entered 
instruments are already there). 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page, wherein, the selected zone will be the 
“Transfer from Zone’, enter values for t he fields ‘From Set No.’ and ‘To Set No.’. Under 
the broad heading “Transfer to Zone” enter or select (through searcher) the Zone Date 
/Code (the status of this zone should be ‘Open’). 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Batch Program successfully invoked”; on 
successful transfer of instruments to another zone.

User should access the menu ‘HPR’ and view the report on “ OUTWARD CLEARING 
TRANSFER OF SETS REPORT”.

The basic difference between the functions “Copy” and “Transfer of Sets” is – ‘in 
Copy both Zones will have the same instruments that had been copied from one 
Zone to another; whereas, in Transfer of Sets the from Zone will lose the sets that 
are being transferred and will be only with that Zone where it had been 
transferred’.

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 16

HMCLZOH - 
Transfer of Sets.pdf

2.4 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Suspend (HMCLZOH)

On invocation of the menu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘ S – Suspend Zone’ from the drop 
down, enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/ Code (which is to be 
suspended; suspension is must after lodgement and verification of instruments and 
before releasing the zone to Shadow Balance status). 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a General D etails page, wherein, the details entered / 
selected during the opening of this zone will be displayed. 
Go to the ‘Statistics’ page, system to display the number of instruments entered along 
with its values and the instrument verified against the instruments entered. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Zone - <<SOL ID>> <<Zone Date/ Zone Code>> 
Suspended successfully”; on successful suspension of an Outward Clearing Zone.

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 8 of 16

2.5 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Revoke Suspension (HMCLZOH)

On invocation of the menu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘ V – Revoke Suspension’ from the drop 
down, enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/ Code (where the status 
of the selected zone is SUSPENDED). 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a General Details page, wherein, the field Zone Status 
will be displayed as ‘SUSPENDED ZONE’. 
Go to the ‘Statistics’ page, system to display the number of instruments entered along 
with its values and the instrument verified against the instruments entered. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Zone - <<SOL ID>> <<Zone Date/ Zone Code>> 
Revoked successfully”; on successful revoke suspension of an Outward Clearing Zone.

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 9 of 16

Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a General Details page, wherein, the details entered /

Maintain Outward Clearing Zone (HMCLZOH) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 10 of 16

Maintain Inward Clearing Zone (HMICZ) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 18

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to have a complete control over In ward 
Clearing (Paper Based instruments) of a Bank. It starts from Opening of an In ward 
Clearing Zone to the Closure of that zone. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Maintain Inward Clearing Zone – Open Zone (HMICZ)

On invocation of the menu “HMICZ”, select ‘O-Open Zone’ from the drop down, system 
to display the User’s logged-in SOL as the default value for the field ‘SOL ID’. 
Enter or select (through date picker) a valid date for the field ‘ Zone Date’; also, enter or 
select (through searcher) a valid ‘Zone Code’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the General page; the user needs to enter valid office 
A/c. s for the fields – ‘Head Office Cr. A/c. ID’, ‘Cheque Reject A/c. ID’, ‘Counter Reject 
A/c. ID’, ‘Short Claim A/c. ID’, ‘Excess Claim A/c. ID’, ‘Inter Clg. A/c. ID’. Select value 
“Y-Allowed” through drop down for the field ‘Negative Carving’. Enter a valid value for 
the field ‘Limit of Part Tran.’ As per requirement the user may key -in data for other 
optional fields. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Zone - <<SOL ID>> <<Zone Date/ Zone Code>> 
Opened successfully”; on successful opening of an Inward Clearing Zone.

Maintain Inward Clearing Zone (HMICZ) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 18

2.2 Maintain Inward Clearing Zone – Inquire (HMICZ)

On invocation of the menu “HMICZ”, select ‘I – Inquire’ from the drop down, system to 
display the User’s logged-in SOL as the default value for the field ‘SOL ID’. 
Enter or select (through date picker) a valid date for the field ‘Zone Date’; also, enter or 
select (through searcher) a valid ‘Zone Code’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the General page; and display all the existing details 
that were keyed-in during opening or modification or any other event of this zone. User 
may visit other ta bs, such as ‘Accounting Statistics’, ‘Instrument Statistics’ and 
‘Transactions’. 
Click on the button “Back”, to return back to the criteria page of the menu HMICZ.

Maintain Inward Clearing Zone (HMICZ) Job Card

2.3 Maintain Inward Clearing Zone – Suspend (HMICZ)

On invocation of the menu “HM ICZ”, select ‘S – Suspend Zone’ from the drop down, 
system to display the User’s logged-in SOL as the default value for the field ‘SOL ID’. 
Enter or select (through date picker) a valid date for the field ‘Zone Date’; also, enter or 
select (through searcher) a valid ‘Zone Code’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a General page, and display all the existing details that 
were keyed-in during opening or modification or any other event of this zone. 
User to visit the tab ‘Accounting Statistics’, thi s tab will display the details of Dr. / Cr. 
Amounts for the fields – ‘Clearing Credit as per Advice’, ‘Excess Claim’, ‘ Short Claim’, 
‘Inward Reject’, ‘Counter Reject ’, ‘Outward Reject’, ‘Extn Reject’, A/c. ID’, ‘ Customer 
and Office A/c. Debit’ and ‘Total’. 
Go to the ‘ Instrument Statistics’ tab, system to display the number of instruments 
‘Drawn on Us’, ‘Not Drawn on Us’, ‘Listed but not Received’, ‘Received but not Listed’ 
as well as the totals of Excess Claim and Short Claim. 
Finally, visit the ‘Transactions’ tab – this tab will dis

sted’ 
as well as the totals of Excess Claim and Short Claim. 
Finally, visit the ‘Transactions’ tab – this tab will display the Tran ID, Tran Date, Posted 
(whether the Tran is posted or not), Details etc. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Zone - <<SOL ID>> <<Zone Date/ Zone Code>> 
Suspended successfully”; on successful suspension of an Inward Clearing Zone.

Current Account - Opening Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 10

1. Overview 
Current Account Opening – In finacle before opening of an account the Customer must 
have a CIF ID, where all the General Information about the customer is captured. All the 
information that are common to all accounts is captured during CIF creation and by 
default populated while opening an account.

2. Business Flow 
The menu option HOAACCA is invoked for opening of a Current Account. The details 
process as follows – On invocation of the menu Criteria page is populated.

2.1 Current Account Opening - Criteria Page / Basic Information

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Basic 
Information 
1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open. Valid 
values are O-Open/ T- Copy from Template. 
2. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique 
CIF ID of the customer. 
3. SOL ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the SOL ID 
in which you want to open an account. 
4. CCY – Mandatory Field- Select through search or Type the currency 
code in which the account will operate. 
5. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the 
code of the scheme under which the account is to be opened. 
6. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - Select through 
search or type the GL Subhead under which the account is to be 
opened. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme 
Code typed must exist. 
7. User may enter valid values in optional fields – ‘Multi CCY A/c. ID’, 
‘Permanent A/c. ID’, ‘Channel ID’ and ‘Limit ID’, 
8. Click on ‘GO’. (System will navigate to the General Details page)

Current Account - Opening Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 10

9. For ‘Function’ – Option –‘T-Copy from Template’ – User to create 
template using menu option ‘HFCTMPL’, which can be used for 
creating a new record. It is just like copy function.

2.2 Current Account Opening – General Details 
On clicking of ‘Go’ button in criteria page the General Details page is displayed.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
General 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. A/c. Name – Mandatory Field - The name specified for the Customer ID 
during customer creation is displayed by default. It can be modified. 
3. A/c Short Name – Mandatory field – System automatically shows the 
short name which can be modified. 
4. A/c Opening Date – Mandatory field - Select or type the date on which 
the account is being opened. The BOD date is displayed by default. 
5. A/c. Statement - Mandatory field - Select or type the mode of generating 
the account statement. Valid Values: B – Both/N – None/P- Pass Book/ 
S – Statement.

Current Account - Opening Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 10

6. Allow A/c. Exemption for CCY Transaction Report - Mandatory field – 
Click the appropriate value to indicate the account exemption for 
currency transaction report. Valid Values are – Yes/No. 
7. Charge Level Code, Location Code, A/c. Manager ID, Cash Debit/Credit 
Limit Exception, Clearing Exception Limit Dr./Cr., Transfer Exception 
Limit Dr./Cr., Channel Level Code, Ledger No., Collect Charges, 
Turnover Details, Notes, Relative to Staff, Preferential Calendar Base, 
Additional Calendar Base, Statement Frequency, Local Calendar , 
Dispatch Mode, Mode of Operation , Next Print Date, Contact Phone 
No., Enable Pass Sheet Frequency at Related Party, Allow Sweeps, 
ECS Enabled, Appl.Ref.ID, Preferred Language Code and Name in 
Preferred Language are Optional fields. User can select or enter valid 
values for these fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

2.3 Current Account Opening – Interest Details 
User to select the ‘Interest Details Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General 
Details’. This tab displays the details of the Interest is to be paid or collected or both for 
the said account along with Tax Details.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function

Interest 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and

2. The values specified at the Scheme Parameter level using the HGSPM

can be modified - Pay Int., Collect Int., Cr. Int. % Min. / Max., Dr. Int. %

he interest 
table applicable to the account.

by default populated while opening an account.
