Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 3 of 11

Table of Contents

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 11

1. Overview 
Overdraft Account Opening – In finacle before opening of an account the Customer must 
have a CIF ID, where all the General Information about the customer is captured. All the 
information that are common to all accounts is captured during CIF creation and by 
default populated while opening an account.

2. Business Flow 
The menu option HOAACOD is invoked for opening of an Overdraft Account. The detail 
process is given below – On invocation of the menu Criteria page is populated.

2.1 Overdraft Account Opening - Criteria Page (Basic Information)

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Basic 
Information 
1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open. Valid 
values are O-Open/ T- Copy from Template. 
2. For ‘Function’ – Option –‘T-Copy from Template’ – User to create 
template using menu option ‘HFCTMPL’, which can be used for 
opening of accounts t hrough option ‘T’. It is just like copy function. 
For Function option ‘T’ ‘Template ID’ Field is mandatory. 
3. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique 
CIF ID of the customer. 
4. SOL ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the SOL ID 
in which you want to open an account. 
5. CCY – Mandatory Field- Select through search or Type the currency 
code in which the account will operate. 
6. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the 
code of the scheme under which the account is to be opened. 
7. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - Select through 
search or type the GL Subhead under which the account is to be

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 11

opened. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme 
Code typed must exist. 
8. User may enter valid values in optional fields – ‘Multi CCY A/c. ID’, 
‘Permanent A/c. ID’, ‘Channel ID’ and ‘Limit ID’. 
9. Click on ‘GO’. (System will navigate to the General Details page).

2.2 Overdraft Account Opening – General Details 
On clicking of ‘Go’ button in criteria page the General Details page is displayed.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
General 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. A/c. Name – Mandatory Field - The name specified for the Customer ID 
during customer creation is displayed by default. It can be modified. 
3. A/c Short Name – Mandatory field – System automatically shows the 
short name which can be modified. 
4. A/c Opening Date – Mandatory field - Select or type the date on which 
the account is being opened. The BOD date is displayed by default. 
5. A/c. Statement - Mandatory field - Select or type the mode of generating 
the account statement. Valid Values: B – Both/N – None/P- Pass Book/ 
S – Statement. 
6. Allow A/c. Exemption for CCY Transaction Report - Mandatory field – 
Click the appropriate value to indicate the account exemption for 
currency transaction report. Valid Values are – Yes/No.

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 11

7. Reason for Exemption Status Change – Co-mandatory field (if, ‘ Allow 
A/c. Exemption for CCY Transaction Report’ is ‘Y’) – Type the reason for 
status change for exemption. 
8. Charge Level Code, Location Code, A/c. Manager ID, Cash Debit/Credit 
Limit Exception, Clearing Exception Limit Dr./Cr., Transfer Exception 
Limit Dr./Cr., Channel Level Code, Ledger No., Collect Charges, 
Turnover Details, Notes , Relative to Staff, Preferential Calendar Base, 
Additional Calendar Base, Statement Frequency, Local Calendar , 
Dispatch Mode, Mode of Operation , Next Print Date, Contact Phone 
No., Enable Pass Sheet Frequency at Related Party, Allow Sweeps, 
ECS Enabled , Appl.Ref.ID, Preferred Language Code and Name in 
Preferred Language are Optional fields. User can select or enter valid 
values for the required fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

2.3 Overdraft Account Opening – A/c. Interest Details 
Please select the ‘A/c. Interest Details Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General 
Details’. This tab displays the details of the Interest is to be paid or collected or both for 
the said account along with Tax Details.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Account 
Interest 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. The values specified at the Scheme Parameter level using the HGSPM 
menu option is populated by default. These values can be modified. 
3. Int. Cr. A/c. – Mandatory field – Select or type the mode of interest credit 
for the account. Valid values are - O- Operative A/c./S- Original A/c./T- 
Payment System /L- Parking A/C.

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 11

4. Int. Dr. A/c. - Mandatory field – Select or type the mode of interest debit 
for the account. Valid values are - O- Operative A/c./E - Operative or 
Original A/c. /P- Operative/Parking A/c./S- Original A/c./L- Parking A/C. 
5. A/c. Pegged - Mandatory field – Click the appropriate value to indicate if 
the account is to be pegged. Valid Values: Yes/No/Relative. 
6. Remaining fields are optional fields. User can select/enter the valid 
values in required optional fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

2.4 Overdraft Account Opening – Interest Slab 
User to visit the ‘Interest Slab’ after successful submission of the ‘General Details’ and 
‘Account Interest Details’.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Interest 
Slab 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. Start Date – Mandatory field - Select or type the start date for the interest 
application. The start date is account open date by default for the 1st 
record. 
3. End Date - Mandatory field - Select or type the end date for the interest 
application. The end date is calculated based on tenor of slab. 
4. Int. Table Code - Mandatory field - Select or type the interest table code. 
The interest table code will be default populated from the scheme level 
for the first record. For subsequent records the 1st records’ interest table 
code will be defaulted. However, it can be changed. 
5. Tenor of Slab(MMM/DDD) – Mandatory field - Type the tenor of the slab 
in months and days. 
6. Remaining fields are optional fields. User to select or enter valid values 
in the required fields.

7. Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 8 of 11

2.5 Overdraft Account Opening – Scheme Details 
User to visit the ‘ Scheme Details T ab’ after successful submission of the ‘General 
Details’, ‘Interest Details’ and ‘Interest Slab’.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Scheme 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. The value specified in the Scheme Details of the HGSPM menu option 
is populated by default. This can be modified.

3. All the fields are optional. User can enter/select valid values for the 
required fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

2.6 Overdraft Account Opening – Account Limit Details 
User to visit the ‘Account limits Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General Details’, 
‘Interest Details’ and ‘Slab Details’ and ‘Scheme Details Tab’.

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 9 of 11

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Account 
Limit 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. Sanction Expiry Date – Mandatory field – Type the date till which the 
sanction limit is valid. 
3. Document Date - Mandatory field – Type the document date for the 
sanction limit. 
4. Penal Interest Start date - Mandatory field – Type the date from which 
penal interest has to be added. 
5. Drawing Power Indicator - Mandatory field – Select the drawing power 
indicator from dropdown. Valid values are - D – Derived/E – Equal/M – 
Maintained/P – Parent. 
6. All other fields are optional fields. User can select/type valid values in 
the required fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

2.7 Overdraft Account Opening – Related Party Details 
User to visit the ‘Related Party Details Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General 
Details’, ‘Interest Details’ and ‘Account Slab Details Tab.’ ‘Scheme Details Tab’ and ‘Limit 
DetailsTab’.

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 10 of 11

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Related 
Party 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. For option ‘Add’ - Relation Type – Mandatory field - Select from drop 
down a valid value. Valid values are- A - Authorized Signatory/C - Co-
Obligant/D – DSA/G – Guarantor/H - Legal Heir/J - Joint Holder/L - Letter 
Of Authority/M – Main/O – Others/P - Power of Attorney/S - Portfolio 
Statement/V - LHV Hirer. 
3. Title, Name and Address Line1 of the related party are mandatory fields. 
User to enter valid values in these fields. 
4. Amount field is mandatory. Type the amount that has to be set as the 
maximum limit amount up to which the related party can perform 
transactions on the account. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

Overdraft - Account Opening JobCard

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 11 of 11

2.8 Overdraft Account Opening – MIS Codes

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
MIS 
Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and 
Scheme Codes are displayed on the top of the screen. 
2. All fields are optional. User to select/enter valid values in relevant and 
required fields. 
Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will display the result message.)

2.9 Overdraft Account Opening – Result page

END OF DOCUMENT

Term Deposit - Account Opening: Before opening of an account the Customer must have 
a CIF ID, where all the General Information about the customer is captured. All the 
information that are common to all accounts is captured during CIF creation and by 
default populated while opening an account.

2. Business Flow 
The menu option HOAAC TB is invoked for opening of a Term Deposit Account. The 
details process as follows – On invocation of the menu Criteria page is populated.

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Basic 
Information 
1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open. Valid 
values are O-Open/ T- Copy from Template.

template using menu option ‘HFCTMPL’, which can be used for 
creating a new record. It is just like copy function. For Function option 
‘T’ ‘Template ID’ Field is mandatory. 
3. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique 
CIF ID of the customer. 
4. SOL ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the SOL ID 
in which you want to open an account. By default home Sol ID is 
populated. 
5. CCY – Mandatory Field- Select through search or Type the currency 
code in which the account will operate. 
6. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the 
code of the scheme under which the account is to be opened. 
7. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - Select through 
search or type the GL Subhead under which the account is to be 
opened. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Sche

rch or type the GL Subhead under which the account is to be 
opened. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme 
Code typed must exist.

‘Permanent A/c. ID’ and ‘Channel ID’ if required.

Pass Sheet Print Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
Use the HPSP menu option to generate statements of accounts, combined statements 
and payment system messages, that may be regular or in duplicate 
2. Business Flow

2.1 Printing of pass sheet (HPSP)

Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Option 
1. Invoke the menu HPBP (System navigate the Detail page) 
2. Statement Type: Click the appropriate value to indicate the type of statement to 
be printed. 
Valid Values: 
Statement of A/c. 
Combined Statement. 
MT940 or MT950 Payment System Message 
MT942 Payment System Message 
Note: 
The value Statement of Account is displayed by default. It can however be 
modified. 
3. Event: Click the appropriate value to indicate if the statement is to be printed in 
duplicate. 
Valid Values: 
Regular 
Duplicate 
Note: 
The value Regular is displayed by default. It can however be modified 
4. Sol id: Select or type the ID of the service outlet set in which reside the accounts 
whose statements you want to print 
5. Account Number: Select or type the account number from which the statement 
is to be generated. 
Note: 
It is mandatory to specify a value for at least one field out of the A/c. ID, GL Sub. 
Head and Scheme fields for pass sheet or payment system message 
6. Select or type the range of CIF ID of the accounts for which the stateme

ds for pass sheet or payment system message 
6. Select or type the range of CIF ID of the accounts for which the statement is to 
be generated. 
Note: 
It is mandatory to specify a value in the CIF ID From field if a combined statement 
is to be generated. 
7. Date: Select or type the from date for which the statement is to be generated. 
8. Period: Select or type the range of dates for which the statement is to be 
generated. 
Note: 
The previous working date is displayed by default in the Period To field. It can 
however be changed 
9. Pass Sheet Holder: Click the appropriate value to indicate if the statement is to 
be generated for only the pass sheet holders. 
Valid Values: Yes, No 
10. Click the appropriate value to indicate the page size of the statement to be

Pass Sheet Print Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

printed 
11. Click the appropriate value to indicate if the statement is to be generated only 
for the Principal Customer (Account holder) or for all the customers associated with 
the entities. Valid Values: Principal Holder Only, All 
12. A/c id: Click the appropriate value to indicate the type of accounts to be 
included in the generated statement. 
Valid Values: Open, Closed, Both 
Note: 
Closed accounts will be reflected in the combined statement only if the value in this 
field is Closed or Both 
13.Print details when no transactions: Click the appropriate value to indicate if the 
statement is to be generated even if there are no transactions after last print 
14. Click on to submit button( system will generate the report and user can 
download the required report)

Pass Sheet Print Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 6

2.2 HPR report

END OF DOCUMENT

1. Overview 
The HRECSHF menu option generates a report of all accounts from which shortfall amount was 
recovered. You can select the accounts from which the shortfall amount is to be recovered and 
on clicking SUBMIT, the system also generates a transaction for recovery

2. Business Flow

2.1 Generating report (HRECSHF) 
Function Navigation of the Selected Function 
Option 
1. Invoke the menu HRECSHF (System navigate the Detail page) 
2. SOL ID: Select or type the ID of the service outlet set to be used for 
recovery of the shortfall amount. 
Important: This field is used to provide flexibility to club accounts in the same 
service outlet/ branch/ data centre for recovery purposes. 
Note: 
If the service outlet ID is typed, all records for that particular service outlet will 
be selected. 
3. Report to: Type the name of the person to whom the report is to be 
addressed 
4. Click the appropriate option button to indicate whether the shortfall amount 
should be recovered from the operative account. 
Valid Values: Yes, No 
5.click on to submit button (system will display the result screen)

Standing Instruction Maintenance (HSSIM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 19

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Add / Verify/ Cancel/ Modify/ Delete/ 
Undelete/ Revoke Suspend/ Copy from an existing and Inquire an existing Standing 
Instruction of a customer. This Standing Instruction will execute automatically on 
regular basis (as per the input entered) as a batch job until the system date (BOD date) 
matches with the End Date (as entered) of the said Standing Instruction. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Standing Instruction Maintenance – Add (HSSIM)

On invocation of the menu “HSSIM”, select the value ‘A-Add’ from drop down for the 
mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the details page, here under the tab ‘Header Details’ 
click the radio button for either of the values – Bank Induced or Customer Induced. 
Enter or select (through searcher) a valid Customer ID for the field CIF ID. System w ill 
auto-populate the user’s logged-in SOL Id as the default SOL for the field ‘SOL ID’. 
Set-up the field ‘Standing Instruction Frequency’, which could be ‘Daily’, ‘Monthly’, 
‘Quarterly’, ‘Weekly’, ‘Half Yearly’, ‘Yearly’ etc. Also select the Execution Tim e, valid 
values are ‘A – Before Change of Date’, ‘B – After Change of Date’, ‘D – Anytime’, ‘E – 
Every Time’, ‘T – Time Based’. 
Enter of select (through date picker) a valid date value for the field ‘Next Execution 
Date’. 
When the user wants to end the execution of this Standing Instruction (SI), an End Date 
should be entered on which the execution of this SI will end. 
In between, for an intermittent suspension on the execution of this SI, Use

on which the execution of this SI will end. 
In between, for an intermittent suspension on the execution of this SI, User should enter 
values for the fields – ‘Suspend Start Date’ and ‘Suspended Till’. 
When the radio button “Yes” is clicked for the field ‘Resume after Suspension Period’; 
the resumption of execution of this SI will happen just after the date entered for the field 
‘Suspended Till’. 
Click the radio button ‘Yes’ for the field ‘Validate CCY Holiday’, if the Currency Calendar 
is to be checked for currency specific holidays while executing this SI. 
Click the radio button ‘Yes’ for the field ‘Autopost’, if the transaction needs to be posted, 
generated because of execution of this SI. 
Click the radio button ‘Yes’ for the field ‘Carry Forward if Failed’, when the user wants to 
continue with the subsequent execution of the SI, even there had been a failure in one 
occasion. 
Enter details for the Fee Details and Execution Condition section, if required.
ed.

Move to the tab ‘Instruction Details’ 
System will display default radio button value “No” for the field ‘Create Memo Pad 
Entry’. Enter a valid currency code for the mandatory field ‘CCY’. 
Enter the A/c. ID, select a value from drop down for the field ‘Amt. Type’. Values for the 
field ‘Amt. Type’ – a) Fixed – an amount for this SI execution on regular basis has to be 
entered for the field ‘Amt.’; b) Variable – Enter the details for variable amount in the 
fields under the ‘Variable Condition’ section; c) Script – Enter the name of the script for 
this SI under the ‘Script’ section; d) Contra Balancing – It is generally used, when the 
amount entered for Debit Part Tran Credit Part Tran has to be same (meaning there are 
only 2 part tr ans, one for Debit and another for Credit) ; e) Table Code – when table

Pool of Funds Maintenance (HSWEEPS) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 11

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Create/ Verify/ Cancel/ Modify/ Inquire/ 
Suspend and Revoke Suspend a pool of accounts of a customer. This Pool of Funds 
from different accounts of the same customer helps the customer to view the total 
outstanding with the Bank, just by accessing this Pool. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Pool of Fund Maintenance – Create (HSWEEPS)

On invocation of the menu “HSWEEPS”, select the value ‘C-Create’ from drop down for 
the mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Enter or select (through searcher) a valid Account No. for the field A/c. ID; if required 
enter or select (through searcher) a valid CIF. for the field CIF ID. Enter a valid value for 
the mandatory field ‘Pool Description’. 
Select a radio button value either ‘Single CCY’ or ‘Multiple CCY’ for the field ‘Pool 
Type’. 
Select a radio button value either ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for the field ‘Autoregularization’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the details page, where system will display all the 
Accounts under the entered CIF ID. User to click the check box under the column 
‘Sweep’ which are to be included for the creation of this Pool of Fund. 
In the Section on ‘Fee Details’ 
User can select the radio button either ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for the field ‘Collect Charges for 
Sweep’. When selected ‘Yes’, the user has to enter the A/c. no. for Debit A/c. ID (from 
this A/c. charges for sweep are to be collected). Enter values for the field ‘C reation 
Event’ and ‘Sweep R

. ID (from 
this A/c. charges for sweep are to be collected). Enter values for the field ‘C reation 
Event’ and ‘Sweep Regularization Event’. 
The field ‘Modification Event’ becomes mandatory when the radio button ‘Yes’ is 
selected for the field ‘Collect Charges for Modification’. 
Click on SUBMIT.

System to display a success message “ Pool created successfully – Pool ID: <<Pool 
ID>>” on creation of this Pool of Funds for the CIF ID. 
Click on the button ACCEPT, system will navigate back to the criteria page of the menu 
HSWEEPS

Pool of Funds Maintenance (HSWEEPS) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 11

2.2 Pool of Fund Maintenance – Verify (HSWEEPS)

On invocation of the menu “HSWEEPS”, select the value ‘V -Verify’ from drop down for 
the mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Either – a) Enter or select (through searcher) a valid Account No. for the field A/c. ID 
(for which Pool of Funds had been created and awaiting verification). or 
b) Enter or select (through searcher) a valid CIF for the field CIF ID. (for which Pool of 
Funds had been created and awaiting verification). or 
c) Enter or select (through searcher) a valid Pool ID for the field Pool ID. (for which Pool 
of Funds had been created and awaiting verification)

Term Deposit Extension (HTDEXT) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to extend the tenor of an existing Term 
Deposit. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Term Deposit Extension – Extend (function).

On invocation of the menu “HTDEXT”, select the value ‘ E-Extend’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the Term Deposit Number for 
the field A/c. Id (whose tenor has to be extended). Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the existing details of 
the selected Term Deposit. Enter valid values for the field ‘New Deposit Period 
(Months/ Days)’. This new period should be greater than the existing period. Click on 
SUBMIT. 
System will display a message that the selected Term Deposit had been extended 
successfully.

2.2 Verification of Term Deposit Extension – Verify (function). 
On invocation of the menu “HTDEXT”, select the value ‘V-Verify’ through drop down for 
the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the Term Dep osit Number for the 
field A/c. Id (whose extension is to be verified). Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details that were 
entered during the ‘Extend’ function. Click on SUBMIT.

Term Deposit Extension (HTDEXT) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

System will display a message that the selected Term Deposit whose tenor had been 
extended is verified successfully.

2.3 Cancellation of Term Deposit Extension – Cancel (function).

On invocation of the menu “HTDEXT”, select the value ‘ X-Cancel’ through drop down 
for the field ‘Function’. Enter or select (through searcher) the Term Deposit Number for 
the field A/c. Id (whose extension of tenor has to be cancelled). Click on GO 
System will navigate the user to a details page and will display the details that were 
entered during the ‘Extend’ function. Click on SUBMIT.. 
System will display a message that the selected Term Depos it whose tenor had been 
extended is cancelled successfully.

Term Deposit Extension (HTDEXT) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 6

Term Deposit Renewal (HTDREN) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 7

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to renew an existing Term Deposit either on 
its due date or any date after its due date. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Term Deposit – Renewal (HTDREN)

Pre-requisites – 
a) The renewal can be done either on the maturity date or on any date after the maturity 
date. 
b) Before, Renewal, interest should be applied to the Term Deposit, by using the menu 
‘HTDINT’. 
c) After application of interest, TDS should be deducted on the Term Deposit, by using 
the menu ‘HTDSCALC’.

On invocation of the menu “HTDREN”, select the value ‘R-Renewal’ through drop down 
for the mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Enter the Term deposit ID for the field mandatory field ‘A/c. ID’ ( whose tenor has to be 
renewed for a new tenor). 
Click on GO

System to navigate the user to the details page and will auto-populate the BOD Date as 
the default value for the field ‘Effective Open Date’. User to select the radio button 
either ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for the field ‘Calculate Overdue Intt.’. System to auto- populate the 
existing values of this Term Deposit which is being renewed. 
Based on the requirement, the value for the field ‘Renewal Period (MMM/DDD)’ may be 
edited. 
Click on SUBMIT to save this Term Deposit Renewal. 
System will display a success message on r enewal of a Term Deposit – “Account 
renewed successfully.”

Term Deposit Renewal (HTDREN) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 7

2.2 Term Deposit – Renewal Cancellation (HTDREN)

On invocation of the menu “HTDREN”, select the value ‘ X-Cancel’ through drop down 
for the mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Enter the Term deposit ID (the status after the renewal should be unverified) for the 
field mandatory field ‘A/c. ID’ (whose renewal is to be cancelled). 
Click on GO

System to navigate the user to the details page and will display all the values that were 
either, entered/ edited or continued with the previous Term Deposit’s (prior to renewal) 
values in non-editable mode. 
Click on SUBMIT to cancel this Term Deposit Renewal. 
System will display a success message on cancellation of renewal of a Term Deposit – 
“Cancellation Operation Successful On A/c. ID <<Term Deposit ID>>”.

Term Deposit Renewal (HTDREN) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 7

2.3 Term Deposit – Renewal Verification (HTDREN)

On invocation of the menu “HTDREN”, select the value ‘V-Verify’ through drop down for 
the mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Enter the Term deposit ID for the field mandatory field ‘A/c. ID’ , which is to be verified 
after renewal. 
Click on GO

System to navigate the user to the details page and will display all the values that were 
either, entered/ edited or continued with the previous Term Deposit’s (prior to renewal) 
values in non-editable mode. 
Click on SUBMIT to verify this Term Deposit Renewal. 
System will display a success message on verification of renewal of a Term Deposit – 
“Account verified successfully.”

Term Deposit Renewal (HTDREN) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 7 of 7

END OF DOCUMENT

Tax Deducted at Source Calculation (HTDSCALC) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 5

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to calculate the Taxes on Interest Paid/ 
Interest Accrued. A report is also generated after the TDS calculation on Interest Paid/ 
Interest Accrued. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Tax Deducted at Source (HTDSCALC)

On invocation of the menu “HTDSCALC”, system to auto -populate the user logged- in 
SOL ID as the default value for the field ‘SOL Set ID’. Enter a valid value for the field 
‘Report To’. 
The TDS Calculation on interest accrual can be done for one or for a given set of 
continuous Account Numbers, or for one or for a given set of continuous GL Sub Head 
Codes, or for one or for a given set of continuous Scheme Codes . Even it can be for 
one or for a given set of continuous CIF IDs. 
The radio button field ‘Tax Deduct ed at Source on Paid/Accrued Interest will by default 
be enabled for the value ‘For Paid Interest’. But as per requirement the User can 
change to ‘For Accrued Interest’ or to ‘For Upload’. 
For ad hoc calculation of TDS Calculation, user can select the radio button ‘Ad Hoc 
Run’ but if the calculation is for actual with update in the database, user should select 
the radio button ‘Actual Run with Database Update’. 
System will auto -populate the BOD Date as the default date for the protected field ‘Up 
to Date’. 
Click on SUBMIT. 
System will calculate the TDS based

Date as the default date for the protected field ‘Up 
to Date’. 
Click on SUBMIT. 
System will calculate the TDS based on the input in the background and User has to go 
to HPR menu for accessing the TDS Calculation Report.

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Inquire an existing transaction for any of 
the transaction types, through this menu option. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Transaction Inquiry – (HTI)

On invocation of the menu “HTI”, system will auto-populate the value ‘I – Inquire’ for the 
protected field ‘Function’. 
Enter that Transaction ID for the field ‘Transaction ID’ along with the correct 
combination of the ‘Transaction Date’, whose details are to be inquired. 
Click on GO

System to navigate the user to the details page and will display the existing values of 
the selected Transaction ID in non- editable mode. User should visit all the Part Tran 
pages of this Transaction ID. 
Click on the button OK, system will navigate back to the criteria page of the menu HTM.

Transaction Maintenance (HTM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 14

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Add/ Post/ Verify/ Modify/ Inquire/ Delete/ 
Copy/ Copy from Template – Journal Entries for many a transaction types such as 
‘Cash – Receipt as well as Payment’, ‘Cash – Cross Currency Receipt as well as 
Payment’, ‘Transfers – Bank as well as Customer induced’, ‘Clearing – Inward as well 
as Outward’, ‘Interest – Paid as well as Collection’, ‘Standing Instructions’ etc. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Transaction Maintenance – Add (HTM)

On invocation of the menu “HTM”, select the value ‘A-Add’ from drop down for the 
mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Select (through drop down) a valid value for the field Transaction Type/ Subtype. 
Click on GO 
Select the radio button either ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ for the field ‘Part Transaction Type’. Enter a 
valid A/c. ID (system to auto -display the A/c. Name). Enter the ‘Ref. CCY/Amt.’; when 
the Ref. CCY entered is any currency code other than INR, system will force to enter 
values for the field ‘Rate Code’ based on the rate code of the Ref. CCY, system to auto-
populate the rate (but this value is editable). 
Enter details of the transaction in the field ‘Transaction Particulars’. 
If a cheque issued for debit, then enter the details of the instrument in the fields 
‘Instrument Type’, ‘Instrument Alpha/Srl. No.’ and ‘Instrument Date’. 
System will auto -populate the BOD Date as the default value for the field ‘Value Date/ 
General Ledger Date’. The field ‘Value Date’ is editable, not the General Ledger Date (it 
is protected also). 
Based on the requirement – the user can key -in values f

editable, not the General Ledger Date (it 
is protected also). 
Based on the requirement – the user can key -in values for ‘Additional Part Tran 
Details’, ‘Partitioning Details’, ‘User Additional Details’, ‘Release Lien Details’, ‘Payment 
System Details’ etc. by selecting the appropriate values through drop against the 
bolded field name ‘Options’. 
In the similar way enter details for the next Part Trans, so as the total of all Debit Part 
Trans equals the total of all Credit Part Trans, so as the transaction balances. 
Click on SAVE.

System to display a success message “ Transaction ID <<Tran ID/ BOD Date>> added 
successfully”, on creation of this Transaction (Journal Entry) 
Click on the button OK, system will navigate back to the criteria page of the menu HTM.

Transaction Maintenance (HTM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 14

Transaction Maintenance (HTM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 14

2.2 Transaction Maintenance – Post (HTM)

On invocation of the menu “HTM”, select the value ‘P – Post’ from drop down for the 
mandatory field ‘Function’. 
Enter the Transaction ID, which is to be posted. 
Click on GO 
(The User who creates the transaction, can also post the transaction during Add, if any 
other User does the Posting, the transaction gets verified along with Posting). 
System to navigate the user to the details page and will display the existing values of 
the selected Transaction ID. User should visit all the Part Tran pages of this 
Transaction ID. 
Click on SUBMIT.

System to display a success message “Transaction ID <<Tran ID/ BOD Date>> Posted 
successfully”, on posting of this Transaction (Journal Entry) 
Click on the button OK, system will navigate back to the criteria page of the menu HTM.

Enter the Transaction ID, which is to be posted. 
Click on GO 
(This Function verify is required only when the User who creates the transaction, also 
posts it. Then another User is required to verify this posted transaction). 
System to navigate the user to the details page and will display the existing values of

Transaction ID. 
Click on SUBMIT.

System to display a success message “Transaction ID << Tran ID/ BOD Date>> verified 
successfully”, on verification of this Transaction (Journal Entry) 
Click on the button OK, system will navigate back to the criteria page of the menu HTM.

verified). 
Click on GO

System to navigate the user to the details page and will display the existing values of

Transfer Transaction Upload Maintenance (HTTUM) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 7

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to upload the transactions through a flat file 
(text file), where the data in the flat file should be as per the format that Finacle system 
can accept and create a financial transaction through that upload of file. The transaction 
Subtype(s) for which data can be uploaded in Finacle Application are: ‘Clearing – 
Inward as well as Outward’, ‘Interest – Paid as well as Collection’, ‘Standing 
Instructions and Bank Induced Standing Instructions’, ‘Transfers – Bank as well as 
Customer induced’, ‘‘ECS – Inward as well as Outward’, A/c. Revaluation, ‘Back Office 
Transaction’, ‘CDB Waste’, ‘OSC Waste’, ‘FCDB Waste’, ‘FDB Waste’, ‘MUL Waste’ 
etc. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Term Deposit – Renewal (HTDREN)

Pre-requisites – 
The flat file (.txt file) containing the data to be uploaded should be as per the acceptable 
format for uploading in the Finacle Application.

On invocation of the menu “HTTUM”, enter a valid value for the field ‘Report To’. S elect 
one of the Transaction Subtype from the list of values through drop down f or the 
mandatory field ‘Transaction Subtype’. Click the radio button “Enter” for the mandatory 
field ‘Action’. 
Select a valid value from the list of values through drop down for the field ‘RMI’. Enter a 
valid description in the field ‘Transaction Remarks’ for the Part Trans of this transaction 
that is going to be created through this upload. 
Click the radio button value “Local File Path” for the field ‘File Location’. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”.

System to navigate the user to the next page, user needs to select the file name 
through the ‘BROWSE’ button for the field ‘Upload File Name’. Click on “GO”.

System will navigate to another page and display the message “Batch Program 
successfully invoked”.

User should go to the HPR menu and select that record which has details of the 
successfully uploaded file. View the Transaction ID.

Go to HTM menu and Post the Transaction (for the flow of HTM menu, please visit the 
Job Card on HTM).

Update Cheque Status (HUCS) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 6

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Modify, Verify, Cancel (the modification) 
and Inquiry the status of an individual Cheque issued to the selected A/c. Id. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Update Cheque Status – Modify (function)

On invocation of the menu “HUCS”, select the value ‘M-Modify’. Enter or select (through 
searcher) an account number for the field ‘A/c. ID’, whose cheque leaf’s status is to be 
modified. Enter the Cheque Number for the mandatory field ‘Instrument Alpha/ No.’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navi gate the user to the details page display ing the Current Status of the 
selected Cheque Number and allows the user to select a status (other than the current 
status) through drop down for the field ‘New Status’. 
System will display a message ‘Modified Successfully’.

2.2 Update Cheque Status – Verify (function)

On invocation of the menu “HUCS”, select the value ‘ V-Verify’. Enter or select (through 
searcher) an account number for the field ‘A/c. ID’, whose cheque leaf’s status is 
modified and awaiting verification. Enter the Cheque Number for the mandatory field 
‘Instrument Alpha/ No.’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the details page displaying the Current Status of the 
selected Cheque Number as well as the ‘New Status’ (non-editable field). 
System will display a message ‘Verified Successfully’.

Update Cheque Status (HUCS) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 5 of 6

2.3 Update Cheque Status – Cancel (function)

On invocation of the menu “HUCS”, select the value ‘X-Cancel’. Enter or select (through 
searcher) an account number for the field ‘A/c. ID’, whose cheque leaf’s status is 
modified and has to be cancelled. Enter the Cheque Number for the mandatory field 
‘Instrument Alpha/ No.’. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the details page displaying the Current Status of the 
selected Cheque Number as well as the ‘New Status’ (non-editable field). 
System will display a message ‘Successfully Cancelled’.

2.4 Update Cheque Status – Inquire (function)

On invocation of the menu “HUCS”, select the value ‘I – Inquire’. Enter or select 
(through searcher) an account number for the field ‘A/c. ID’, whose cheque leaf’s status

Interest and Tax Advice (INTTDADV) Job Card

Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 4

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to view the Interest Paid and TDS deducted 
on the individual account(s) (Term Deposits) of the selected Customer. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Interest and Tax Advice – (INTTDADV)

On invocation of the menu “INTTDADV”, system will display the user’s logged SOL ID 
as the default value for the field SOL ID. Enter a value for the field ‘Report To’. Enter or 
select (through searcher) the Customer ID for the field CIF ID (whose interest paid and 
taxes deducted on it, on every account is to be viewed). 
System to display the system date (i.e. BOD Date), as the default date for the field ‘To 
Date’. Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to a details page display ing all the Term Deposits (A/c. 
ID) of this selected CIF ID. Tick the check box for that Ter m De tails (A/c. ID) whose 
Interest and Tax report to be obtained. Click on SUBMIT. 
System will display a message ‘Interest and TDS Advice Report generated’ (this report 
will get generated in the background). User to access this report through the menu 
‘HPR’

Outward Guarantee Maintenance (OGM) Job Card 
Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 4 of 31

1. Overview 
The Finacle system allows the Bank User to Issue, Modify, Copy, Verify, Invoke, Cancel, 
Reverse, Close and Unclose different types of Bank Guarantees such as – Financial 
Guarantees, Performance Guarantees, Shipping Guarantees etc. 
2. Business Flow 
2.1 Outward Guarantee Maintenance – Add (OGM)

On invocation of the menu “OGM”, select ‘A-Add’ from the drop down, enter or select 
(through drop down) an appropriate Guarantee Type, Currency Code (if the selected 
Guarantee Type is an Inland Guarantee, then the currency code should be INR), and the 
valid CIF ID. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the default ‘General’ tab for keying-in data for the fields 
under the section ‘Applicant Details’, ‘Amount Details’ and ‘Other Details’. 
Go to Party Details tab and key-in values for the fields under the sections – ‘Beneficiary 
Details’ and ‘Advising/ Corresponding Bank’. 
Then move to ‘Guarantee Details’ Tab; here key-in values for the fields – ‘Guarantee Sub 
Type’, ‘Purpose of Guarantee’, Guarantee Class’, ‘Effective Date’ etc. Also, key-in details 
for the fields under the section ‘Expiry Details’, ‘Rules’ and ‘Counter Guarantee Details’. 
Next tab ‘Limit Details’ tab, herein, the user can link the limit ID set for this BG Applicant 
with this Guarantee (so as the utilization of the limits can be monitored). 
For margins’ collection for the said guarantee, the detai

antee (so as the utilization of the limits can be monitored). 
For margins’ collection for the said guarantee, the details are captured in the ‘Margin 
Details tab. 
User should move to Charge Details tab, wherein, the system will display the details of 
charges that are to be collection from the BG Applicant for issuance of this BG. 
Based on the requirement – the user may enter data for the for the tabs – ‘Instructions’, 
‘Text Details’, ‘Document’ etc. 
Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
System to generate the message – “Guarantee No. <<Guarantee ID>> added 
successfully”; on successful creation of the Bank Guarantee.

2.6 Outward Guarantee Maintenance – Inquire (OGM)

On invocation of the menu “OGM”, select ‘I -Inquire’ from the drop down, enter or select 
(through drop down) a verified Guarantee Number, whose details are to be inquired. 
Click on GO. 
System will navigate the user to the default ‘General’ tab and will display the existing 
values of all the fields (in non-editable mode) under this tab. 
Then, the user should visit all the tabs (such as Party Details, Guarantee Details, Charges 
Details, Margin Details, Limit Details etc.) and system to display all the existing values

Saving Bank Account Opening Process

Addition

1. Minimum User privilege required: Work Class 110 & Above 
2. Menu option HOAACSB is to be used for account opening data entry. 
3. CIF id of the customer is to be entered 
4. Appropriate Scheme Code is to be selected from the list. 
5. In General Details Tab: Application reference ID, charge level code , Mode of operation, 
Location code to be selected from list. 
6. Visit Interest detail tab 
7. In Scheme Details Tab, Select nomination (Y/N) 
8. When Nomination is kept as Y then in Nomination details Tab enter the CIF of nominee (if 
exists) or nominee details. 
9. In case joint account holder/ authorised signatory user can add details through Related 
Party Details Tab. 
10. Visit Other detail tab 
11. In MIS Codes tab >Click on expand and enter Yes/No in free_text_6 field 
12. On clicking Submit button SB account number will be created and displayed.

Modification

1. Minimum User privilege required: Allowed only for entry user id. 
2. Menu option HOAACMSB is to be invoked. 
3. Account Number to be fetched or entered. 
4. Required modification(s) to be carried out. 
5. On clicking Submit button, modifications will be saved.

Verification

1. Minimum User privilege required: Work Class 300 & Above 
2. Menu option HOAACVSB to be invoked 
3. Account Number to be fetched and selected. 
4. Visit mandatory Tabs : General Details, Interest Details, Scheme Details, Nomination 
Details, Related Party Details And MIS code 
5. On clicking Submit button, account will be verified.

Classification: Internal

EOD procedure for 
Branches 
(Finacle 10.x)

Classification: Internal 
Introduction: 
End-of-Day (EOD) & Begin-of-day (BOD) are operations performed in Finacle to mark the logical end-of-day and 
mark the beginning of next working day. After implementation of Finacle 10, existing procedure of EOD will be 
discontinued and new procedure of will be introduced. This document will help user to understand basic of EOD 
in Finacle 10.x 
Procedure to be followed by branch is as under 
Pre-EOD Activity: 
Before the branch Sol closure, the Branch user in charge of doing ABH /CSOLOP in Finacle 7.x should run 
HSVALRPT & ABH check report for SOL date change mode for their branch. This will give a report for 
transactions which are un-posted/un verified or any issue with clearing zone etc. in their branch. The issues 
identified in the report should be rectified by the branch. Other activities like proxy posting of system 
generated transactions and inter sol Reconciliation should be done before EOD. Details of Pre -EOD menu is as 
under. 
1. HSVALRPT (For Finacle inbuilt errors and validation Report) 
In this input will be 
a. Sol set ID:

enu is as 
under. 
1. HSVALRPT (For Finacle inbuilt errors and validation Report) 
In this input will be 
a. Sol set ID: It will be sol ID of branch. 
b. Execution level: Sol Date Change (For Branch level EOD)

EOD Screenshot 1- HSVALRPT MENU

A Report will be generated listing all the blocking and non-blocking validations. All Blocking validation 
needs to be corrected for EOD process to proceed. Menu to check reports is HPR.

EOD Screenshot 2-HPR MENU

Classification: Internal 
Report will be as follows:

EOD Screenshot 3-Validation Report

2. MISREP (For Bank induced customised Errors and validation report): This is 
existing report from fin-7 system. This report will be continued to provide custom validation report 
to branches. This report will generate list of Unverified Lockers, Unverified Signatures, Unprinted 
DD, Office A/cs Balance not Zero etc. Procedure to generate this report is shown as under.

EOD Screenshot 4 –Custom validation report MISREP MENU

EOD Screenshot 5- MISREP Menu screen

Classification: Internal

Report will be generated in HPR. All the unverified operations will be listed in the reports. Sample 
report is shown as under:

EOD Screenshot 6- Custom validation report in HPR

3. HSSI( Sol Status Inquiry): Branch can check current BOD, last EOD and status of current EOD 
process using HSSI menu. Sample Sol status before initiation of EOD process is as below. This menu 
is most important to track the process during actual EOD process. Branch should run EOD menus 
only when EOD Event Status is “EOD EVENT NOT IN PROGRESS”

EOD Screenshot 1-HSSI MENU

Classification: Internal 
EOD PROCESS: 
For Sol, EOD process comprises of 2 steps/menu. 
 HSCOD 
 HSCOLD 
Details of each step are as under: 
a) HSCOD: This operation/menu changes date of sol. This is a separate step and was not present in 
Finacle 7.x. It is also used to run all the batch jobs set up in the HSCOD event. This event could include 
Pre-date Change Jobs, Actual Date Change Batch Job and Post Date Change Batch Jobs, if any. 
Input required after invoking this menu are ‘Sol id’ and ‘No of Parallel Sols’. Both the values will be 
auto-populated.

EOD Screenshot 2-HSCOD MENU 
Some important Batch job are ‘PRSL1’ and ‘PRSL2’ which are executed at different events 
of HSCOD. All these events will run internally under HSCOD menu (Branch does not require run 
any menu). Branch can track EOD progress under HSSI menu. Sol status during HSCOD operation 
is shown below

EOD Screenshot 3-HSSI STATUS WHILE SCOD RUNNING 
The internal events involved in the HSCOD operations: 
1. PRESCOD: This event includes pre -date change validations and pre -date change batch jobs . 
Those batch jobs which need to run before change of a date of a SOL, are run. It executes important 
batch job PRSL1.Call PRESCOD Jobs for sol Execute PRSL2. (This will change db_stat_code from I to 
P<means PRESCOD operation completed successfully> )Other batch jobs executed in this 
operation are: TOD Status Updates, Automatic FFD Opening, Transfer of Funds from FFD, Closure 
of regularized FFD , SI Execution – Defined for EOD, SI Carry for ward,, SI Charge Calculations, 
Automatic Verification of Matured Term Deposits, Batch Jobs which cannot be executed during as 
of Last Day.

2. SCOD: This is the event which actually changes the SOL date. Validations done before the actual 
change in the SOL date are: 
i) Holidays exist between current BOD date and next working date 
ii) SAC all the online Real Users

Classification: Internal 
iii) Actual DATE CHANGE Happens.

3. POSTSCOD: This event includes post -date change batch jobs, if any. The mandatory jobs 
executed during POSTSCOD are: 
Sol Status in HSSI, after completion of HSCOD operation is shown below

EOD Screenshot 4-SOL STATUS AFTER COMPLETION OF SCOD 
In case of any error, Branch should check the report in HPR and complete the blocking operations 
and should invoke ‘HSCOD’ menu again.

b) HSCOLD: Menu consists of closure validations, batch jobs which the bank wants to run “As of 
yesterday”, and Marking SOL as closed. 
The HSCOLD menu option does: 
 Updates the Sol to closed status 
 Basic validations based on Bank Status 
 Fires the validation batch jobs and batch jobs configured for SCOLD Event.

EOD Screenshot 5-HSCOLD MENU 
 Sol status in HSSI menu after sol closure is as under.

EOD Screenshot 6-SOL STATUS AFTER RUNNING HSCOLD 
In case of any issue in the process during execution will give error. Branch should check Error report 
generated under HPR. After rectification of error, Branch should again submit the HSCOLD menu.

Classification: Internal 
Error Detection and Resolution: 
If any error is encountered during entire EOD process, user can check the sol Status using HSSI menu and 
then check error report in HPR. User should rectify the error and then invoke the same menu again. Error 
report will have details of resolution. In Addition to HSSI menu user may check status of batch job 
execution in HBJMON menu. 
HBJMON: 
This menu lists status of batches executed during entire EOD process. Inputs required for invoking this 
menu are 
 From Execution Date: EOD date 
 From Run for Date: EOD date 
 To Execution Date: EOD date +1 
 To Run for Date: EOD Date +1

On submit, list of batch job with current status will be displayed on the screen. For failed Batch job, error 
report will be generated in HPR with

. In case any errors observed during the EOD process, Branches should report to Data 
center for resolution.

Finacle10: Loan Account Restructuring Version: 1 Page 1 of 1

HLARA : Loan Ac Rescheduling

Menu HLARA is used to reschedule the Loan Accounts. LNRES Menu has 
been replaced by HLARA in FIN-X.

Function R- Rescheduling

 Reschedule By- P (Using Parameters) 
 Ac I/D - Enter Account No. 
 Option Code- Select Option Code from searcher. 
 Select Details Sanction Reference no, Rescheduling Effective Date, 
Restructure Reason (to be selected from searcher, Promo Contribution & Turn 
over Amount for some of the Option Code. 
 Click on Go. Next page will open. 
 Payment Parameter Tab- Fill the details like No of Instalment, Instalment Start 
Date, 
Interest Start Date, Instalment Frequency & Interest Frequency.

IDCM 
(Inward Documentary Credit Maintenance)

For the issuance of Inward DC the mandatory fields has to be visit are as follow:

Function code: E (ADVISE) 
1. User has to furnish required function code (E), DC Type, Currency and CIF ID (Customer_ID). In 
case of Inland LC user has to select Function code (W), DC Type and Message Type. 
2. Further on Submission of the Pre-Requisite Screen General Detail Tab will open.

 General Details : 
 The Mandatory fields which has to be furnished by the user are Account ID , Issue Date, DC 
open Value, Other Bank`s ref no. then click on next tab: Related Party Details

 Related Party Details : 
1. User has to furnish the detail under below Mandatory tabs which is as follow : 
 Applicant Detail: User can furnish CIF ID of Foreign Party, if they have, or they may furnish 
the sender detail at Name, and Address tab. 
 Issuing Bank Details: Beneficiary Bank and Branch Field or BIC field has to be entered by the 
user. 
 Available With Bank: Bank and Branch Field or BIC field or Available with field has to entered 
by the user and later on select the appropriate option at “Available by Field.” 
 Drawee bank Details 
 Click on next tab : DC Details

 DC Details : Mandatory Fields under this tab are as follow :

Applicable Rules Tenor Tenor period Due Date Indicator Date of Expiry 
Place of Expiry Country Of Expiry Latest Date of 
Shipment 
Negotiation Period

 Click on next tab : Charge Details

 Charge Details: In the mentioned tab system will calculate and auto populate the charges as per 
the charge event Id, user has privilege to change the charges as per their requirement or approval.

 Click on Submit, if all above mentioned fields are filled/fetched correctly then DC reference ID 
will be Created/Generated.

 Function code : V (Verification) 
 In this Functionality user has to furnish the DC reference Id which is to be verified, and click 
on “GO”. 
 Further all above mentioned Tab has to visit for verification of the Documentary Credit.

Finacle-10 - HIRM Version – 1 1 | P a g e 
(Inward Remittance Maintenance)

HIRM 
(Inward Remittance Maintenance)

 For Function code : J (Lodge & Realize) 
1. User has to select function code ( J), and furnish required Remittance Type, Remittance 
Currency and CIF ID (Customer_ID). 
2. Further on Submission of the Pre-Requisite Screen General Detail Tab will open.

 General Details : 
1. The Mandatory fields which has to be furnished by the user are as follow : 
 Operative account ID 
 Charge Debit account ID: it will be auto fetched based on operative account, user can modify 
the account as per the remitter instruction. 
 Remittance amount 
 Remit Country 
 Purpose of the Remittance 
 Notional Conversion Rate Code/Rate 
 Click on next tab : Party Details

 Party Details : 
1. User has to furnish the detail under two tabs which is as follow :

 Sender Details: User can furnish CIF ID of Foreign Party, if it is created at their end, or they 
may furnish the sender detail at Name, and Address tab. Here Name, Address1, and country 
is the mandatory field.

 Correspondent Bank Details: In this field user has to furnish the Nostro Bank Detail, in which 
fund is lying and user is going to debit the account. User has to furnish Bank and Branch 
Field or Swift Code of the Nostro Bank, based on that Remaining fields will be auto 
populated. 
 Click on next tab : Instrument Details

 Instrument Details : 
1. At this tab user has to furnish the details at Instrument amount Field and drawee Bank Details. 
For Drawee Bank details user has to furnish Bank and Branch field based on the same rest value 
will be auto populated. 
 Click on next tab : Realization

 Realization: At this tab major fields are auto populated, User has to furnish the Nostro Value Date 
only, in case of transaction under currency Conversion. If Amount is going to be credited to the 
Foreign Currency account i.e. EEFC account then the filed EEFC Credit amount has to be furnished, 
based of entry remaining fields will be auto Populated. 
 Click on next tab: After Realization tab there is a Predefined sequence to visit next three 
tabs these should be visit in same sequence for any kind of Remittances. Sequence to visit 
the next tabs are Event Details >>> Charge Details >>> Transaction Details

Finacle-10 - HIRM Version – 1 2 | P a g e 
(Inward Remittance Maintenance)

 Event Details : In the mentioned tab if there is any Treasury rate taken for the mentioned 
Remittance then we have to select Rate code /Rate , or else card rate will be applicable for further 
Process. 
 Click on next tab : Charge Details

 Charge Details: In the mentioned tab system will calculate and auto populate the charges as per 
the charge event Id, user has privilege to change the charges as per their requirement or approval. 
 Click on next tab :transaction Details

 Transaction Details: In the mentioned tab , user has to select the Nostro Reference in the Field 
“Transaction ref no.”, further user will click on “Visit f ield” with option “O-Originating”, since it 
is a n Inward Remittance, a new page will open with Debit no te advice, if system generated 
calculation is correct then user has to validate the value by clicking the option “Validate” then 
click on calculate and at last click on “Accept”. 
At last user has to click on validate, if system thrown any error rectify the same and revalidate 
further submit by this Remittance reference ID will be Created/generated. 
 For Function code : V (Verification) 
 In this Functionality user has to furnish the remittance reference Id which is to be verified, 
and click on “GO”. 
 Further all above mentioned Tab has to visit for verification of the Remittance.

NPATM: NPA Ac Transaction Maintenance : Menu NPATM is used to recover the 
amount in NPA Accounts.

Function A-Addition of Record

vilege required: Minimum work class should be 110

HOCTV: Outward Clearing Transaction Bulk Verification 
1. Minimum user privilege required: Special Assistant (Minimum 300) 
2. Menu option HOCTV is invoked to Mass Verification of Outward Clearing Instruments 
3. Clearing zone should be in Suspended state. 
4. Enter Zone Date/Zone Code, Enter Start Set No and End Set No. and click on SUBMIT

Observation:

Branches will use HTROFSET menu for Transferring of sets from one day to another day in case of 
zone is not suspended.

Steps for HTROFSET: 
1. Zone date and Zone code should be entered 
2. Zone should open for Next Day 
3. Old Set number and Zone date Zone code should be entered 
4. Transfer zone code should be entered for next day

Suspend/Revoke Suspend/Release to Shadow Balance

1. This menu option is the next step to stop user to enter new instrument in HOCTM. 
2. If the zone is already suspended than it can be revoked by selecting V-Revoke Suspend menu 
option. 
3. R-Release to Shadow balance menu option is used to release funds in clearing to the particular 
accounts.

HMARKPEN: Mark Pending 
1. Minimum user privilege required: Minimum 600 
2. Menu option HMARKPEN is invoked to marking an Instrument as pending for regularization. 
3. Enter Zone Date, Enter Zone code, Enter SOL ID, click on Go 
4. Select Instrument/Instruments to mark it pending and click on Submit. 
HREVPEND: Revoke Pending 
1. Minimum user privilege required: Minimum 400 
2. Menu option HREVPEND is invoked to Revoke Pending Instrument/Instruments which are 
marked pending using menu option HMARKPEN. 
3. Enter Zone Date, Zone Code, Sol ID and Click on go. 
4. Select the Instruments which are marked pending using Menu Option HMARKPEN will be 
displayed for revocation. 
Outward Return: (Used by Service Branches) 
1. Menu option HMICZ Function: O to be invoked to Open Inward Return Zone for Outward 
Clearing. 
2. Enter Zone date, Zone code and click on Submit 
3. Menu option HICTMO Function: A to be invoked to Add Outward instruments in Inward Clearing 
Zone

4. Enter Instrument No (Ensure Outward Clearing Zone to be in Release to Shadow Balance

Finacle-10 Term Loan Account Opening Version -1 1 | P a g e

Education Loan Account

Account Opening: Scheme Code-LA722

1. Menu option HOAACLA is to be used for account opening data entry. 
2. CIF id of the customer is to be entered. 
3. Appropriate Scheme Code is to be selected from the list. 
4. In General Details Tab, enter Location Code, select Mode of operation (as applicable) 
and A/c Statement (as applicable). 
5. Visit A/c Interest Tab, view the details. Add A/c. Preferential Interest if required. 
6. Visit Loan Details Tab, enter Loan amount and Loan period, Operative Acct, Debt Ack Date. 
7. In LA Interest Tab, enter Interest deferred up to date as end date of moratorium period 
given in the account(Date on which interest will be demanded). Deferred/Applicable Interest 
Rate should be 0 & “A” – Application 
8. Visit Payment Plan Tab, enter No. of instalments, instalment start date, interest start 
date. 
9. Visit Payment Schedule Tab, view details of EMI by clicking on Amortization Schedule 
button 
10. Visit MIS Codes Tab, enter appropriate code. 
11. In Account Limits Tab, enter Sanction date, Expiry date, document date, review Date. 
Select Sanction Level, sanction authority, enter Limit

, enter Sanction date, Expiry date, document date, review Date. 
Select Sanction Level, sanction authority, enter Limit Ref No, Select Drawing Power 
Indicator. 
12. Visit Related Party Tab, enter the co- applicant /guarantor details if any. 
13. Visit Fee Tab, view the details. 
14. Visit Others Tab view the details. 
15. On Click of Submit button, mark-up rate added and Interest Table Code changed to RBRLY 
automatically .Repricing Plan should be changed to V (for Non Pegged accounts). 
16. On clicking Submit button Loan account number will be created and displayed.

Modification in Account Opening before Verification

1. This is allowed only for user who has opened the account. 
2. Menu option HOAACMLA is to be invoked. 
3. Account Number to be selected. 
4. Required modification(s) to be carried out. 
5. On clicking Submit button, modifications will be saved.

Finacle-10 Term Deposit Closure Version -1 1 | P a g e

Term Deposit Account Closing Process 
(One Pager Document)

Closure (Z)

1. Minimum User privilege required: Work Class 110 & Above 
2. Menu option HCAACTD is to be used for closure of account. 
3. Function Z and A/c id of the customer is to be entered 
4. Visit Closure details Tab and enter Repayment A/c id. 
5. Visit Closure Exceptions- Enter Closure Remarks 
6. The value for field 'Withdrawal amt(Principal)' is default populated 
7. On clicking Submit, Account closed successfully, which needs authorisation.

Trail Closure (L) 
1. Minimum User privilege required: Work Class 110 & Above 
2. Menu option HCAACTD is to be used for closure of account. 
3. Function L and A/c id of the customer is to be entered 
4. Visit Closure details Tab and enter Repayment A/c id. 
5. Visit Closure Exceptions- Enter Closure Remarks 
6. The value for field 'Withdrawal amt(Principal)' is default populated 
7. Closure value date auto populate to BOD and can be changed to future date if required.

Verification / Cancellation

Minimum User privilege required: Work Class 300 & Above 
1. Menu option HCAACVTD to be invoked 
2. Account Number can be entered or fetched from the searcher. 
3. Visit Closure details Tab. 
4. On clicking Submit button, account closure will be authorised/ cancelled 
(System display the transaction details of the account).

Finacle an Overview 
Finacle was developed in 2000 and implemented in banks Finacle is being used by 180 
banks across the globe about 50 countries this works in CBS as we say India and if we work in finacle 10 
it works globally that is called UBS means universal banking solution solutions suit of products in finacle.

SCHEME TYPE: 
 Length: 3 characters 
 Types: 11 types of Scheme is available for Customers Accounts 
 06 types of Scheme is available for Office Accounts

SCHEME CODE: is a Product Code where parameter settings are been done. 
 Length : 05 characters. There is no limit of creation of number of Scheme Codes 
SET ID: this is a Logical set of Groups of SOL IDs. One SOL can be a part of so many Logical Groups 
SOL ID: Length: 08 characters 
BANK ID: 2 characters

OFFICE ACCOUNTS: 
 is meant For internal transactions 
 No CIF ID is required

FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS: All transactions like Cash/Transfer/Clearing 
NON-FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS: Issuance of Cheques, DD etc.

1. CRM : means Customer Relationship Management it consists all customers related 
information so it is Customer Information File . Hence, this is called CIF. There are 
two types of CIF IDs: 
a. Retail Customers’ CIF ID: there are five entities under Retail 
i. Customer: Any person who are having account with our Bank. 
ii. Non Customer: walk-in customer 
iii. Contact: The person who are indirectly linked with our Bank and not 
having any account. It can be related party of customer (introducer, 
guarantor, Joint Holder, Letter of authority holder etc. 
The persons who are indirectly linked to the Bank and don’t have 
ACCOUNT Such as Guardians or Legal Guardian of a Minor, LOA 
(Letter of Authorization), POA (Power of Attorney), Executives of a 
Corporate Customer etc. 
iv. Lead : who shows interest to convert into prospect. 
v. Prospect: from the business angle, Banks recognize some affluent 
prospective persons. And trying to sell product or do business in 
future. To provide them efficient and good services, Bank may open 
a CIF ID (Customer ID) in advance. 
b. Corporate Customer

e. To provide them efficient and good services, Bank may open 
a CIF ID (Customer ID) in advance. 
b. Corporate Customers’ CIF ID: there are three Entities under Corporate 
i. Customer 
ii. Non customer

iii. Prospect

2. BOI-CORE: this the main platform for all banking operations. 
3. After creation of CIF ID and linking it to BOICORE. All other banking operations are 
done from BOICORE. 
4. SVS : Signature Verification System. This is related to signature, like capturing, 
modification, addition, deletion and verification of signatures. 
5. FI: this is financial integrator. Means interface between finacle and other 
applications 
6. RI : this is report infrastructure 
All above activities are under SSO Admin means Single Sign On technology. In SSO, following 
functions can be done: 
1. Creation of users 
2. Defining roles of users 
3. Resources defining to users 
4. Change credentials

 In finacle 10.x now user himself can get relogin if he/she is getting “Already Logged in” message. 
 Means now SAC facility has been taken out. 
 EOD process is totally revamped. Now its working 24x7 basis. EOD automatically takes place 
on 00:00 in midnight of the country. 
 EOD has been replaced with “CHANGE OF BUSINESS DATE” which is de-coupled with EOD 
process 
 Note: Creation of Dummy CIF for Welcome Kit Supported. Upload Template for CIF Bulk Generation 
Creation of CIF – Maker – Two Options 
i) Save : allows Maker to modify the details 
ii) Submit: forwards the CIF for approval. Maker will not be able to modify 
Approval Process has a maximum of 9 steps 
1. DEDUP Check 
2. DEDUP Decision Making 
3. Blacklist Check 
4. Blacklist Decision Making 
5. Negative List 
6. Decision Making in Negative List 
7. Document Check 
8. Decision Making in Document Check 
9. Approval- Options Approve , Reject and Close 
 Approve – Verification of CIF 
 Reject – Return to Maker for modification 
 Close – Deletion of CIF without verification

maker and assigned to self by checker, CIF appears in self-tray of the user 
Group-Tray – Any CIF is pending for approval it appears in the group tray. 
All users can access group-tray.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

Finacle Core Job Cards

Inventory Maintenance

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

Inventory in Finacle 10

Inventory: Inventory means stock of items that a bank holds. From the banking 
perspective, inventory can be classified into security and non-security items.

a. Security items are Demand Drafts, Cheque books, Term deposit receipts, 
Travelers cheques & Gift cheques of d ifferent denominations etc., where 
tracking of each single unit of inventory is required.

b. Non security items are items like furniture, fixtures, stationary items other 
than security items etc.

Inventory Class: In Finacle 10 software, each inventory ite m is identified by the 
inventory item code defined for it. The system allows defining of major classification of 
inventory item called as Inventory Class. Inventory Class 
code can be created using the HRRCDM menu. For e.g. Cheques, DD, FDR etc.

a. Inventory Type: Within the major inventory class, there may be a minor 
classification of inventory item called Inventory Type. For e.g. Current account 
(CA) Cheques, SB Cheques etc. Can be created using HIIM menu.

b. Location Class and Location Code : The place where the inventory is 
located is identified with Location Class, Location Class is a broader 
classification and Location Code is a sub -classification of a location where an 
inventory is held. Inventory items are moved from one location to another 
location. While Location Class is defined in HRRCDM, the sub classifications 
of Location Class which are referred to here as Location Code is defined 
through HILCM menu option

INVENTORY ITEM MAINTENANCE –HIIM

After defining the inventory class, the sub classification of inventory i.e., the various 
types of inventory under a particular Inventory Class are defined using the menu option 
HIIM.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

INVENTORY MOVEMENT AUTHORISATION MAINTENANCE – HIMAUM

In Finacle, it is possible to define users as authorisers for movement of inventory for a 
Specific location. For a Location Class, you can specify up to a maximum of two 
authorisers. The menu option for defining the authorisers is HIMAUM.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

INVENTORY LOCATION CODE MAINTENANCE –HILCM

While Location Class is defined in HRRCDM, the sub classifications of Location Class 
which are referred to here as Location Code is defined through HILCM menu option.

INVENTORY MOVEMENT- HIMC

Moving an inventory from one location to another requires following information:

Originating Location class Originating Location code To Target location class Target 
location code

The first movement of inventory shall happen

1. ZZ-EXT to DL (Double Lock)

2. DL TO EMP ID

One of the officers shall move the outstanding stock of security forms i.e. FD Receipts, 
demand draft, pay order, cheque books into the system in

i. “Add” (A) mode.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

ii. The officer shall submit to generate an inventory transaction id. He will 
 note down the same. 
iii. The other official (designated vide HIMAUM menu) shall invoke HIMC. 
 (Verify) mode to verify the above inventory transaction

Inventory Movement Maintenance - HIMAUM

After adding the new Inventory to a location it can be modified or cancelled before 
verification.

CANCELLATION

Cancellation of a movement is done using function “X” of HIMC menu option. It should 
be borne in mind that a cancellation of a movement is possible only before verification 
of the same. However, it is not mandatory that the user who initiated the movement has 
to cancel --- it can be cancelled by any other user too.

MODIFICATION

Modification can be done before verification and can be done by any user.

Authorizer ID

Any inventory movement from one location to another has to be authorised by the 
designated users only, (Set up done through HIMAUM). However, i f for any reason, the 
user who is designated for authorising a movement is not available, then the User id 
specified in „Authorizer ID‟ field of that designated User can authorise the movement. 
This type of authorising on behalf of another user is applicab le only for the inventory 
movement.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

INVENTORY MOVEMENT INQUIRY

Using HIMI menu option, the user can specify the available criteria and able to know the 
actual position /location of the inventory

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

INVENTORY STOCK SPLIT / INQUIRY (ALL LOCATION) - HISIA

If the user wants to inquire or split the inventory on others locations then the menu 
option HISIA can be invoked. The screen interface and navigation will be similar to 
HISAI except that the user will be in a position to change the employee location code.

INVENTORY STOCK MERGE / INQUIRY- (OWN LOCATION) -HIMAI 
The inventory merge or inquiry on own location can be done through HIMAI.

Cheque book Maintenance

Bank customers use instruments for debiting the accounts for various reasons like 
withdrawing of fund, payment, transfer to other accounts etc. For this purpose bank 
needs to provide the valid instruments to customer and for which all the records are 
kept in Bank register. These negotiable instruments are in general term known as 
Cheques and are security items whose documentation and records are securely 
maintained.

Issue of Cheque Book:

1. The issue of cheque book to customer has two levels.
2. The entry of cheque book by maker that are to be issued and the 
verification of same need to be done.
3. The cheque book instruments are kept under custody since these are 
security items.
4. The enterer and verifier should not be same.
5. At the time of verification of the issue, cheque book should be available 
with the issuing person i.e. custodian.
6. It is possible to select any range of cheque leaves for issue.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

7. It is suggested that at the employee location, cheque books should be split 
as per the physical cheque book size
8. It is possible to collect Cheque book issue service charges
9. It is possible to transfer cheque book issued to a customer from one 
account to another account of same customer falls under a specific 
scheme type.


Cheque Issue Menu: HICHB Function-I (ISSUE)

During the cheque book issue user need to put the A/C No. of customer and type of 
cheque leaves like SB, CA, CC or OD etc. , cheque available with and collect MICR 
charges or not.

Option acknowledgment awaited is opted than use menu HCHB M for 
acknowledgement of cheque for use of cheque book by customer. Acknowledgement 
Received should be “Y

Cheese Book Maintenance Menu Option: HCHBM

Through this menu option, maintenance activities like Caution, Destroying, revoking and

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Inventory Maintenance

acknowledgement of cheques can be done. It is possible to explode the entry to enquire 
leaf details.

After issuing of Cheque book, verification is done by Menu: HICHB / HICHBA Function 
–V (Verify) If modification done using HCHBM it should be also verified.

Stop Payment: Menu Option: HSPP 
 (This Menu option is used to stop or revoke payment processing). This facility is 
provided to stop a single cheque or multiple cheques in a series. Stop payment or 
revocation charges can be co llected through event based charge collection at the time 
of verification process.

Verification of Stop payment process, Menu: HSPPAU, Function: V

The Payment which is stopped through SPP has to be authorized through HSPPAU 
menu option.

Stop payment charge details can be seen through the option „C‟. Stop payment charges 
are not modifiable. Cancellation of Stop payment process can be done before 
verification by selecting X - Cancel function and after authorization stop payment can 
only be revoked.

Cheque Book Maintenance Menu Option: HCHBM Through this menu 
option, maintenance activities like Caution, Destroying, revoking and acknowledgement 
of cheques can be done. It is possible to explode the entry to enquire leaf details.

Updation of cheque status 
Menu: HUCS This menu option can be used to change the cheque status as Unused 
and Paid. Sometimes it happens that user enters the wrong cheque number and if is not 
actually paid or presented, system update the cheque status when actually that cheque

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

Finacle Core Job Cards

Limit Node

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

LIMIT NODE

Banks sanction various types of limits to an entity or borrower based on the type of 
business and type of requirement. Bank have prudential exposure norms (CAP) to restrict 
its limits to certain extent to borrower. 
Manually it is not possible to maintain and Control over various types of limits of a 
borrower with complex combinations of different facilities availed by the customer all the 
time. 
Finacle provides the feature of LIMIT NODE Nodes that ensures that the customer does 
not draw beyond his limit. L imit Node enables to control and monitor different credit 
facilities (Fund Based & Non Fund Based). 
A separate limit node is created (Menu HLNM) for the total exposure (Parent Limit Node) 
as well as for each type of loan (Child Limit Node). 
All the individual loan limit nodes are linked to the exposure (Parent) limit node. This 
establishes the hierarchy between the Total exposure limit node and the individual limits. 
The limit structure once created may be as under.

Please note If Fund based is fully utilized i.e. up to 25 lakh than here non fund 
based can be utilized for 5 lakh only as the parent limit is only 30 lakh.

Total limit /Parent Limit 
30 Lakh

Child Limit Node
