Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

Creation of LIMIT NODE

A Limit Node is unique Limit ID i.e. Combination of Limit Prefix and Suffix IDs. During limit 
Node creation, the suffix can be entered or selected from the available list while the prefix 
is defined by user to uniquely define. A limit node can be a parent limit node or a child 
limit node. Drawing Power of child limit node will be derived from its parent limit node.

 Type HLNM in the Menu Shortcut field to display Limit Node Maintenance 
screen.

 Select the function Add from the Function dropdown list. 
 In the Limit ID field, select the Suffix from the searcher provided. The Prefix is 
user defined. (Customer ID) 
 Click Go.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

 Enter the Description. 
 Select the currency from the searcher in the CCY field and select INR 
 Select Limit Type as C-CIF ID 
 Enter customer id in the field Limit Type ID 
 Enter Approval Limit.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

 Select Drawing Power Indicator as applicable. 
 Enter Limit Approval Date. This can be BOD date or after BOD date. 
 Enter Limit Expiry date. This has to be a future date. 
 Enter the Limit Effective Date. This can also be BOD date or after bod date. 
 Select the Master Limit Node using the searcher. 
 Visit the Limit Categories tab. Verify consistency of information from the LNM 
Tab.

 Add another CIF if this limit needs to be shared 
 Click Submit. 
 LIMIT ID Will be created with a prefix and suffix, Please Note Down.

Verification of Limit Node

 Type HLNM in the Menu Shortcut field to display Limit Node Maintenance 
screen. 
 Select the function Verify from the Function dropdown list

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

 In the Limit ID field, select the record to be verified from the searcher or 
alternatively, input Limit ID created. 
 Click Go 
 View the details entered. 
 Visit the Limit Categories tab. Verify consistency of information from the LNM 
Tab. 
 Click Submit.

Modification of Limit Node

 Type HLNM in the Menu Shortcut field to display Limit Node Maintenance 
screen. 
 Select the function Modify from the Function dropdown list.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

 In the Limit ID field, select the record to be verified from the searcher or 
alternatively, input Limit ID created. 
 Click Go 
 Make the changes as required. 
 Visit the Limit Categories tab. Verify consistency of information from the LNM 
Tab. Make the changes as required. 
 Click Submit. 
 Verify the record

Glossary of Menus

1. HLNM- Limit Node Maintenance 
Create/verify/modify/delete/inquire a limit node 
2. HLTL- Limit Tree Look Up 
View limit tree details 
3. HLNDI- Entities attached to the Node 
View all the limit nodes along with hyperlinks to view details. 
4. HCULMTI- Customer Limit Details 
View All Limit Ids and Accounts along with details

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Limit Node

5. HACLHM- Account limit History Maintenance 
Attach account to the limit node

Example: A 
Borrower can be sanctioned various facilities like Term Loan, Cash Credit, BG, LC etc. 
with interchangeability of limits with a CAP on each type of facility. 
A Parent limit Node can be created for the Maximum Exposure Limit and Child Limit 
Nodes can be created for Sub Limits and can be attached to the parent limit Node. 
Parent Limit: Maximum exposure to a borrower 
Child Limit 1: Fund Based 
Child Limit 2: Non Fund Based

Child Limit 1.2: Cash Credit 
Child Limit 2.1: Bank Guarantee 
Child Limit 2.2: Letter of Comfort

LOAN 
In a loan, initially the borrower receives or borrow an amount of money from lender called principle 
and obligated to pay back or repay an equal amount to the lender at a later time. Depending on 
nature of advances loan types can be secured, Unsecured, Demand, Term and Subsidized. 
In this we learn how to open an account under scheme code LA651

OD ACCOUNT 
OD Account Opening 
Over draft is a facility that enable a customer to 
A. withdraw from the account up to the sanction limit 
B. maintain a debit account balance and bank will charge interest on debit balance 
There are two type of over draft account 
1. Regular Overdraft Account : This facility offered to the customer where he can utilize the 
sanction limit 
2. Revolving Overdraft: It is a facility offered to the customer with credit card features such as 
billing date, minimum payment, pay by date, penal interest and late fee for late payment. 
 Create CIF ID from CRM option. 
 Open a customer account using menu HOAACOD,CLICK ON ‘Go’

 Enter CIF ID, already created. 
 Scheme Code: Select Scheme code from Drop Down as per the OD facility, say ODTOD 
 Click GO

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Savings Bank

Finacle Core Job Cards

Savings Bank

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Savings Bank

SB ACCOUNT 
Requirement for account opening 
 CIF id 
 Scheme code 
 CCY and 
 SOL-ID 
 CIF and scheme code are mandatory and CCY and sol-id will be defaulted or user-defined. 
Opening of SB account 
 Menu option – HOAACSB 
 Function - Two function options – O & T 
 Open of new account\ T – copy from template (Template ID -In case of 
Account Opening from Template, Template ID Field to be entered. 
Template ID can be created using menu option HFCTMPL) 
 CIF ID – The customer id to be entered. Enter Retail CIF ID. 
 Sol ID- Will be defaulted 
 CCY – By default, it will be INR. In case of account opening in different 
currency, the corresponding currency has to be selected 
 Scheme Code- Choose the correct scheme code such as SB101, SB121, 
SB116 etc. 
 General Ledger Subhead Code- Will be automatically selected based on the 
Scheme Code 
 Permanent A/ C Id - Permanent account id is used for special numbers 
reservation. 
 Channel-id - used if account is opened through other channels. 
Upon entry of various values, 
Click GO

System displays various tabs for data entry 
 General Details –
Job Card FINACLE 10.X Savings Bank

 A/c Name and A/c Short Name– This field is picked up from CIF ID. A/c 
name may be changed based on work class 
 A/c Opening Date – Date of Account Opening .A/c opening date may be 
back-dated. 
 Charge Level Code – Will be picked up from CIF if provided. Charge level 
code can be updated at the account opening level also. 
 Location Code – Select the appropriate code 
 Channel level code will allow for concession from various channels. 
 Collect Charges – Based on the Scheme Code, the default value will be 
set. 
 Relative to Staff – Value can be chosen as Yes or No 
 Staff Id – in case of relative to staff, this value has to be filled. By default 
will be picked up from Relative to staff and staff id field will raise 
appropriate exception at the time of posting of transactions in this 
account by the concerned staff. 
 A/c Statement – Passbook or Both or None can be chosen. 
 Statement Frequency – In case of Statement (Pass Sheet ) and Passbook 
both chosen, the statement frequency has to be defined here 
 Despatch Mode- Despatch Mode of statement has to be 
selected(O

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Signature Verification System

SIGNATURE VERIFICATION SYSTEM (SVS)

Introduction: 
In Finacle 10 signatures and photographs of customers and its employees through Signature 
Verification System. This system can be used to scan the image of the customer and store in 
the database and later use the signature for verification at the time of doing a transaction. This 
also helps in automating the process of verification of the signa tures during normal business 
operations thus reducing the effort and time. 
SVS stores photographs and signatures of banking customers in its database and fetches them 
quickly when required. 
Salient features of SVS: 
 Complies with the core fundamentals of Anywhere Banking system 
 User group management for creating and managing user groups 
 Administrative tasks for carrying out administrative operations such as assigning roles 
and maintaining parameters like password expiry period can be handled. 
 User management for creating and managing users. 
 Signature management for uploading and maintaining signatures. 
 Photograph management for uploading and managing photographs 
 Verification procedure for any activity

g signatures. 
 Photograph management for uploading and managing photographs 
 Verification procedure for any activity c arried out in the application. The concept of 
maker & checker is here also. 
 Audit Info for viewing the audit information carried out on a particular activity 
 Signature manipulation to display signature in multiple modes like original, negative, 
rotate, zooms in, and zoom out. 
SVS has multiple menus like User Group, Admin, User, Rule, Signature, Photograph, Verify, 
Audit Info, Change Password and Logout in the main screen. Most of the menus have common 
options like add for adding a new record, update t o update an existing record and delete for 
deleting a record. 
STEPS TO CREATE A NEW USER IN SVSFOR VIEWING AND ADMINISTRATING

 USER GROUP MANAGEMENT 
SVS system each and every user has to belong to a group and only then he can have access to 
multiple options in SVS. Under the user group management bank can perform operations like 
add, update, delete, purge, recover and upload.

rations like 
add, update, delete, purge, recover and upload.

belongs to that User Group will be able to access the images which have the same image 
access code. Each User Group can have more than one Image Access Codes. Images access 
codes are the codes which are created in order to restrict a user from viewing a specific 
signature or photograph.

Administrative operations can be carried out using the Admin menu.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Signature Verification System

User can assign roles and maintain Application parameter, Session, Users and Account Status. 
Also User can define the Verify option for all the menu options.

4. MAINTAIN ROLES

 ASSIGN ROLE 
This option can be used to assign or remove permissions to the various user groups. The roles 
are basically the permissions/access rights assigned to various user groups based on their 
operations. For example aofficer of deposit is responsible only to view the signature and he/she 
is not associated with creation of users and user groups. So he needs access to menu related 
to signature like add, update, delete, etc. In ord er to assign permissions or define roles select 
Role under the Admin menu. 
In the Assign Role screen all the user groups are listed. Select the user group for which user 
want to assign permissions. 
 MAINTAIN RULE 
Rules are basically conditions defined by a n account holder for performing a banking 
transaction. These rules generally refer to the conditions required for verifying signatures and 
photographs. For each banking transaction, whenever a signature comes for verification, the 
user applies these rules for verifying the signatures and/or photographs.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Signature Verification System

The rules defined can be mapped to account signatures using the A/C. Signature Map option. 
An account may be associated with more than one rule, and each rule may be mapped to 
different sets of signatures. Similarly, signatures can also be mapped to rules associa ted with 
customers or employees, from the Rule menu select A/C Signature Map.

STANDING INSTRUCTION JOB CARD 
 Define Standing Instruction 
 Types of Standing Instruction 
 Creation of Standing Instruction through HSSIM Menu option 
 Significance of various fields in menu option HSSIM 
 Define Contra Balance 
 Related Menu options 
What is Standing instruction? 
 It is used to transfer funds from one Account to other Account. 
 It is a written instruction by a Customer given to Bankers to initiate a transaction on 
his/her behalf at predefined periodicity. 
 The Customer who wants to make payments or remittances of a recurring nature like 
installments to Recurring Deposits or Cash Credit accounts. 
 The account holder may give standing instruct ions to the bank to make these pay ments 
and to make remittances on their behalf on specified dates, for specified amounts or 
when the account satisfies certain conditions specified by the account holder. 
Multiple Standing Instructions 
When there are multip le Standing Instructions f or the same customer, there is a 
requirement to prior itize them i.e. some standing instructions should be run before the 
others

e customer, there is a 
requirement to prior itize them i.e. some standing instructions should be run before the 
others. 
Standing Instructions 
Fixed Standing Instructions Variable Standing Instructions 
Debits are applied to saving account and 
credit for recurring account 
Standing Instructions are applied to current 
account in order to ensure interest on cash 
Credit account is minimized

Credits are permitted to all the accounts 
except for loan accounts

Standing Instructions may apply for fixed 
period at fixed intervals as well as fixed 
amount

Significance of various fields in Menu Option: HSSIM 
SI Type: The standing instruction can be classified as CI or BI.

CIF ID: This is ID of the customer for whom the SI is created. If SI is “Bank Induced”, then 
this field need not be specified.

SOL ID: The SOL ID to which the SI belongs.

Execution Dates: We specify the frequency at which the SI has to be executed. The 
frequency can be Daily, Weekly, Fortnightly, Monthly, Quarterly, Half Yearly and Yearly. If 
that day happens to be holiday then whether it should be skipped or executed the previous 
day or the next day are indicated.

Execution Time: A standing instruction can be executed:- 
A- Before change of date (this is After Business hours) 
B- After change of date (this is opening of Business hours) 
D- Anytime during the day (here after execution according to set rules for this SI, date in 
‘Next Execution Date’ will be stamped as next working date. Hence, further SI will not 
execute in this SI). 
T- Every Time (here after execution according to set rules fo r this SI, date in ‘Next 
Execution Date’ will be blanked and will work for every execution of SI . For execution of 
Standing Instruction the menu is SIE. 
U- Time Based: This opt ion can be used for a particular group and specific t ime. This is 
executed at a specific time of the day. 
Next Execution Date: Initially this date will be the start date for execution of standing 
instruction. Once the SI is executed, system automatically changes to next working date as 
per frequency.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Standing Instructions

End date: The date up to which the standing instruction should get executed is set in this 
field. Once this date is over, the standing instruction will be expired, but not deleted.

Suspended Till: A standing instruction can be suspended anytime during the tenor of SI. If 
specified, the system will not select the SI up to the date mentioned in this field for 
execution .Once this date is over, system will revive execution process.

Auto Post: If this field is selected, system will post the transaction . If it is not selected, then 
system will just create the transaction and leave it in entered status, like a normal posting.

Delete if not posted: User has to specify if Auto Posting Facility is required. If “Yes” system 
will try to post the transaction created. As an extension of this, user also specifies whether 
the transaction created should be deleted, if the system could not post it. If this field is 
selected, then the SI transaction will be rolled back.

Tran – Validate for CCY Holiday: This value must be selected if the currency holiday is to be 
validated for execution of the SI transaction.

Carry Forward if Failed: If an SI has failed or execution conditions are not met, it can be 
tried for execution on the immediate next day which is called carry forward.

Carry Forward max Times: A feature is available through which one can put a cap on the 
number of times a SI should be carried forward. Once this limit is met or the SI is executed 
successfully the SI will be removed from the carry forward list.

Fee Details: This information section is optional. The user can indicate the charges that are 
required to be collected. The user can indicate values for one o r more charge s depending 
upon the requirement. Some examples are as follows:- 
 Only Acceptance 
 Only Execution 
 Only Failure 
 Acceptance and Execution 
 Acceptance and Failure 
 Execution and Failure 
The Event IDs for all the Event Types are created using the HPTTM Menu option. T he user 
can select the appropriate Event ID for the respective Event Type s. Charges are collected at 
different times depending upon the Event Type.

Acceptance event: This Event ID is used for calculation of one time acceptance charge. This 
charge will be calculated and collected as a part of verification of the standing instruction 
record creation. The event ID has to be created for event type SIA in PTTM.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Standing Instructions

Execution Event: This charge is collected as a service charge for the execution of SI. This 
charge is also collected during End of Day process. If for any reason the charge transaction 
cannot be posted, those transac tion will be proxy posed by the system. The event ID is 
created for event type in PTTM.

Failure Event: If the execution of an SI is failed for any reason, this charge is calculated and 
transactions for failure of SI are created during End of Day. If for a ny reason the charge 
transaction cannot be posted to the operative account, it will be proxy posted and a report 
is available. The event ID is created for event type SIF in HPTTM.

Debit Account ID: The user has to specify the account number for which the charges are to 
be debited

After validating the details entered in the Header Details, the user should enter the 
instruction details.

Instruction Details 
Account ID: The account ID to which the transaction amount is debited or created. Also the 
user has to indicate whether this account should be credited or debited.

Memo Pad Entry: System provides a feature of creating a memo pad entry for the account. 
If the system is not able to post a transaction created then the user w ill get an alert that 
there is a pending transaction for the account, which needs to be posted on account of a 
standing instruction. This memo pad/alert is created if this field is selected.

Currency: The currency of the transaction amount has o be specified here.

Amount Type: The value indicated here will determine how the total transaction amount is 
arrived. The values are “F”-Fixed, “V”- Variable, “C”-Contra Balancing and “T”-Table Code.

Fixed (F): In this a fixed amount is specified for the sub instruction. If amount indicator is 
fixed the fields Currency (CCY) and Amount becomes mandatory. 
Variable (V): Using this amount indicator one can set up complex conditions for amount 
derivation. If he value is set to the above field is “V-Variable”, then the fields A/c ID, account 
balance, balance indicator (Debit or C redit), excess/short indicator, percentage and in 
multiples of fields become mandatory under this condition. 
Percentage: If only a percentage of the amount arrived is used for transaction, then the 
user has to enter the percentage here. 
Round off indicator and value : There may be a chance that the amount derived by the 
system is not proper in terms of decimal points. In order to have a proper a mount it could

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Standing Instructions

be rounded off based on indicators mentioned here. The valid values for indicator are “H” -
Higher, “L” - Lower, “N” - Nearest. The rounding off would be done by taking into account 
absolute amount.

Contra Balance 
Contra Balancing: This kind of amount indicator is used to balance a SI transaction. The part 
transaction type of a SI sub instruction having this amount indicator should be opposite of 
other part transaction types in that reference currency. If the amount type is either “V ” or 
“T” then it is a must that the oth er part tran is contra balancing. This can be used for fixed 
SI.

TRANSACTION:

 Status of Transaction: 
1. Entered status: 
Transaction is created by debiting or crediting. In this case, balance of the account is not 
affected. Here the entries are in ‘ENTERED’ status. 
2. Posted status 
By posting the entries, balance of the account gets affected accordingly. Now, here the 
entries are in ‘POSTED’ status. 
3. Verified status 
Although, after posting of entries the balance of account gets affected, but one 
authorise person ensures the gen uineness of the transaction by authorising it. Now, 
finally the entries are in ‘VERIFIED’ status.

 Deletion of Transaction: 
 If the entries are at Entry status, entries can be deleted.

 Online/real time Transaction: 
 Three special menu for doing transactions are available through which the balance 
of the account affects immediately. These menus are: 
 HCASHDEP - Deposit of Cash (using this menu user can do the cash receipt work only) 
 HCASHWD - Withdrawal of Cash (using this menu user can do the cash Payment work only) 
 HXFER - Initiating transfer transaction (using this menu user can do transfer Entries only) 
 HTM - using this menu User can perform all the above three works. 
 Value dated transaction : 
o Every transaction has two dates: 
 Date of Transaction: actual transaction date which consider general ledger 
date. 
 Value date (this is the base for calculation of Interest on true basis) 
 Inter SOL Transaction: transaction of other SOL (branch) done by a different SOL (branch) 
 Although all types of transactions can be handled through HTM , but if any staff has been 
assigned for cash deposit only, for his/her HCASHDEP menu option can be invoked. This

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Transaction Maintenance

CASH TRANSACTIONS WITH DENOMINATIONS 
HTM, HCASHDEP, HCASHWD will have a separate tab for capturing the denominations: 
On click of the ‘Denomination Details’ tab, the user is taken to another screen where the details can 
be captured:

At the bottom of the screen you will find Button “Denominations Details”

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Transaction Maintenance 
5

Care: Denomination Details can be fed first also, but make it a habit to feed amount first in 
the amount field from the Paying-in-slip. 
 Validations in HTM / HCASHDEP / HCASHWD – During Denomination Capture: 
• If Denomination details are not maintained for the Transaction currency, an 
appropriate message is displayed. This does not be block Transaction procedure. 
• All valid denominations of the currency are painted with configured strap / bundle 
size. 
• User must enter the number of notes / coins transacted against required 
denomination value. 
• User must also enter num ber of notes / coins returned (cash return) against 
required denomination value. 
• Valid positive number must only be entered as number of notes / coins – for any 
wrong data entry appropriate error message is displayed in the screen. 
• Sum of denomination value is validated against net transaction amount in said 
currency and if not matching, an appropriate error message should be displayed in 
the screen. 
• If a transaction leg is deleted, respective denomination details are also deleted from 
Database

ayed in 
the screen. 
• If a transaction leg is deleted, respective denomination details are also deleted from 
Database 
• If a transaction leg is modified for transaction amount, validation of denomination 
value against net transaction amount is re -triggered to check if the denomination 
details are proper or need to be re-visited. 
• In case of multi-currency transactions, the denominations need to be captured for 
each currency. In such cases, the denomination capture screen has multiple records 
to capture denomination for each currency. The transaction amount in a particular 
currency (across part transactions) is aggregated for the transaction for 
denomination capture. 
• In case the teller does not have exact change for a particular transaction, the 
denomination amount can be matched by adding the ‘round off amount’ received 
or returned. 
• Teller can enter ‘Remarks’ to indicate such transactions that might be inquired later 
for consolidation.

CROSS CURRENCY DEPOSIT AND WITHDRAWAL 
Finacle-10 supports Cash Deposit and Cash Withdrawal in cross currencies through specific menu 
options in FAB. These can be used only for Cross Currency transactions. The user will not be 
allowed to do uni -currency transactions through these options. If the user enters the 
Deposit/withdrawal currency to be the same as account currency an alert message is raised. The 
following FAB menus are for cross currency Cash transactions: 
Cross Currency Cash Deposit – CASHDEP 
Cross Currency Cash Withdrawal – CASHWD 
 The user has to specify the currency in which the cash deposit/cash withdrawal has to be made 
along with the amount in the “Deposit/Withdrawal Amount” field. 
 The “Amount” field present below the “Deposit/Withdrawal Amount” field represents the “A/C 
CCY and converted amount”, as shown on the Cash Deposit and Cash Withdrawal screens. 
System displays the currency of the account once the account number is specified, while the 
converted amount is displ

System displays the currency of the account once the account number is specified, while the 
converted amount is displayed once the u ser enters the rate code and tabs out. The 
corresponding customer rate is also displayed to the user in the normal rate field. The “Amount 
in A/C CCY” field is protected. 
 An icon to do rate inquiry is provided. Just next to this icon, another icon has been provided to 
accept treasury details. On click of this icon a pop-up box will be displayed in which the user can 
enter treasury rate and reference number.

fields. The Treasury Rate field will be defaulted to the treasury rate as per the set up for the rate 
code given for the transaction 
 In the charges screen provided for cash deposit, cash withdrawal including cross currency 
transactions, Transfer transaction, an icon is provided for each charge rate code clicking on which 
will display the treasury rate and treasury reference number. 
 Also, in charges field, user can enter different rate code for each of the charge legs. For Cross

 If the user modifies the rate beyond tolerance limit a warning will be given to the user. 
However, the user can proceed with the transaction. All other exc eptions for such over-ridings 
will be displayed to the user in online mode. 
 Cash Deposit and cash withdrawal be created as C/CR and C/CP type of transactions respectively

TRANSACTION REVERSAL

Any transaction posted to a customer account cannot be deleted. Reversal of a transaction or 
marking a manually reversed transaction as reversed is done through the menu option HCRT. 
By default, the value for reversal flag in HCRT menu is shown with R – Reversal. Tran ID is a 
mandatory field in case of reversal. Reversal of transaction is permitted only for customer 
operative account – SBA, CAA, CCA and ODA scheme types. The Core Banking Solution will not do 
reversal of already reversed transaction. 
In case of multiple records for the same transaction ID, the Core Banking Solution creates 
accounting entries individually for each selected record. Transaction reversal is allowed for 
transaction pertaining to previous days also. In case of cash transactions, reversal will result in the 
original transactions being reversed to respective accounts.

Transactions which are marked as Reversed, are not taken up for the following: 
• Statement printing 
• Account turnover update 
• Account turnover report 
• Allowed number of withdrawals for charge calculation

The user can select Reverse radio button and Function as Request along with the Transaction ID 
and Transaction Date to be reversed and click Go

The function Reverse is selected in the HCRT Menu option. The Core Banking Solution displays all 
the transactions, based on the criteria indicated such as Account ID, Transaction Amount Low and 
High. The click of Accept determines if all the records displayed must be selected. 
If a particular transaction is to be reversed then Original Tran. Details such as Tran Date, Tran ID, 
Part Tran Srl No. From - To must be specified as input. On the click of Accept, the transaction to be 
reversed is selected from the displayed records. On the click of Submit the selected transaction is 
reversed and a request id is displayed.

Menu: HCRT

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Transaction Maintenance 
14

If the debit transaction which is reversed has a cheque, the status of the cheque which is marked 
as paid, is also updated as unpaid when the transaction is reversed. If the cheque is not updated, 
it is displayed and reversal of the transaction happens. Updation of cheque status together with 
reversal of transaction can be done only for the current day’s transaction. If only the cheque status 
has to be updated, a different menu option (UCS) must be used. 
The verifier can go to the same menu option for authorizing: 
The verifier can click on the searcher next to Ref. No. to view / select list of pending records and 
click Go to verify.

The verifier can click on Submit and system will reverse the transaction and display the transaction 
id. 
Note: In case of a cash transaction that has been reversed, the system is going to reverse the cash 
part tran from the teller account of the verifier.

TRANSACTION INQUIRY

 Transaction inquiry: 
Transactions can be inquired in two ways. The user can invoke the Menu Transaction 
maintenance and do the inquiry or invoke a menu “HTI” – Transaction Inquiry for doing 
the inquiry on a transaction. For this the user should know both the transaction ID and 
the date of transaction. The screen is similar to Transaction maintenance and user 
cannot do any other functions other than inquiry.

 Financial transaction inquiry: 
This menu option provides the user with facility of choosing criteria for selection of

to see the reversal details of the transaction. Reversal details are shown.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Transaction Maintenance

REPORTS 
The following are the reports that are available for transactions maintenance. 
 Financial transaction Report –HFTR 
Reports based on selection criteria such as Account ID, Ref Number, Tran ID, Tran Type, Part 
Tran Type, Instrument Number, Instrument Type, Transaction amount low, Transaction amount 
high, GL Subhead, Value Dated, Account Status, Transaction Status and Enter User ID can be 
generated through the HFTR menu option.

 Generate Transaction ID Report - GTID 
This menu accepts the following inputs: 
Sol / Set Id : This accepts the service outlet or set for which the report is to be generated. 
CCY: Transaction currency for which the report is to be generated. 
Start Date: Start date for the report. It will be populated as BOD date by default. 
End Date: End date for the report. It will be populated as BOD date by default. 
Report Category: This field can accept the following values: 
• A: for all types of transactions 
• M: For manual transactions 
• S: For system generated transactions 
• G: For system generated user modified transactions 
Transaction Type/Subtype: This will accept the valid transaction types and sub types. If 
transaction type is entered as L then Inc. Clg Tran will be default populated as Y and 
protected. 
Part Transaction Type: This will accept the part tran type for which the journal report is to 
be generated. 
Include Clearing Transaction : This field decides whether clearing transactions are to be 
included in the report or not. Possible values are Y/N.

Job Card FINACLE 10.X Transaction Maintenance 
19

A/c. ID: If Transaction report is to be generated for a particular account then that can be 
entered here. 
Note: For the fields being described; there is a section Include. 
If a value is entered in Include section then journal report will be generated for that value. 
If a value is entered in include as No, then journal report will be generated for all the other 
values except the entered values. 
All these fields are having a length of 150 characters with a display length of 19 and 
scrollable.

SOP FOR REMOVAL FOR DNS 
1. Select window+R , type “cmd”

2. Enter command “ncpa.cpl “

3. This will navigate to network connection

4. Double click on Ethernet

5. Click on properties , a dialog box will appear for admin user id password , PLEASE CONTACT 
YOUR REGIONAL OFFICE-IT , FOR USER ID AND PASSWORD
6. Double click on internet protocol version 4 (Tcp/IPv4 )
7. Select “obtain DNS server address automatically “ to remove DNS

8. On selecting obtain DNS server address automatically , click ok

9. Open control panel , go to Internet Option

10. Got to tab advanced >>scroll and come down and make sure “use TLS 1.0 , use TLS 1.1, use TLS 
1.2, use TLS 1.3, fileds are checked , click ok

11. Restart the system

chunks.pdf: HMCLZOH FOR SUSPEND RELEASE AND REGULARIZE.pdf
chunks.text:
Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

HMCLZ OH FOR SUSPEND RELEASE AND REGULARIZE

2.1 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Suspend (HMCLZOH) 
 On invocation of the m enu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘ S – Suspend Zone’ from the drop down, enter or 
select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/ Code (which is to be suspended; suspension is 
must after lodgement and verification of instruments and before releasing the zone to Shadow 
Balance status). 
 Click on GO. 
 System will navigate the user to a General Details page, wherein, the details entered / selected 
during the opening of this zone will be displayed. 
 Go to the ‘Statistics’ page, system to display the number of instruments entered along with its 
values and the instrument verified against the instruments entered. 
 Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
 System to generate the m essage – “Zone - <> <> Suspended successfully”; on successful 
suspension of an Outward Clearing Zone.

chunks.pdf: HMCLZOH FOR SUSPEND RELEASE AND REGULARIZE.pdf
chunks.text:
2.2 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Release to Shadow (HMCLZOH) 
 On invocation of the m enu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘R – Release to Shadow Balance’ from the drop 
down, enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/ Code (the instrum ents entered 
under the selected zone are all verified and the Zone is already suspended). 
 Click on GO. 
 System will navigate the user to a General Deta ils page, wherein, the field Zone Status will be 
displayed as ‘SUSPENDED ZONE’. 
 Go to the ‘Statistics’ page, system to display the number of instruments entered along with its 
values and the instrument verified against the instruments entered (by now all instruments 
should be verified). Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
 System to generate the m essage – “Job initiated. Check print queue after som etime” on 
releasing the zone to shadow balance successfully. User should access the m enu ‘HPR’ and view 
the report o n “OUTW ARD CLEARING RELEASE TO SHADOW BALANCE REPORT”.

chunks.pdf: HMCLZOH FOR SUSPEND RELEASE AND REGULARIZE.pdf
chunks.text:
2.3 Maintain Outward Clearing Zone – Regularize a Zone (HMCLZOH) 
 On invocation of the m enu “HMCLZOH”, select ‘G – Regularize Shadow Balance’ from the drop 
down, enter or select (through searcher) an existing Zone Date/ Code (once this function is 
executed successfully, the zone will get closed). 
 Click on GO. 
 System will navigate the user to a General Details page, wherein, the field Zone Stat us will be 
displayed as ‘RELEASED TO SHADOW BAL’. 
 Go to the ‘Statistics’ page, system to display the number of instruments entered along with its 
values and the instrument verified against the instruments entered (by now all instruments 
should be verified ). Click on the button “SUBMIT”. 
 System to generate the m essage – “Job initiated. Check print queue after som etime”. on 
regularizing a zone with shadow balance successfully. User should access the menu ‘HPR’ and 
view the report on “OUTW ARD CLEARING REGULA RIZATION OF SHADOW BALANCE REPORT”

SOP-HOAACSB

Opening of KCC account

Menu option – HOAACSB

1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open.

2. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique CIF ID of the customer.

3. SOL ID – Mandatory field - By default home Sol ID is populated.

4. CCY – Mandatory Field- By default CCY is populated.

5. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the code of the scheme under which 
the account is to be opened.

6. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - By default General Ledger Subhead Code is 
populated. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme Code typed must exist.

7. Click on ‘GO’. (System will navigate to the General Details page)

2.2 KCC Account Opening – General Details 
Function Navigation of the Selected Function General Details

1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed on 
the top of the screen.

2. A/c. Name – Mandatory Field - The name specified for the Customer ID during customer creation is 
displayed by default. It can be modified.

3. A/c Short Name – Mandatory field – System automatically shows the short name which can be 
modified.

4. A/c Opening Date – Mandatory field - The BOD date is displayed by default.

5. Location Code – Mandatory field- Select the appropriate code From searcher.

6. Mode of Operation- Mode of Operation of the A/c based on customer request such as Self, Either of 
Survivor etc to be selected from searcher.

7.A/c. Statement - Mandatory field - Select or type the mode of generating the account statement. Valid 
Values: B – Both/N – None/P- Pass Book/ S – Statement.

A/c Statement – Passbook or Both or None can be chosen. 
 Statement Frequency – In case of 
Statement (Pass Sheet ) and Passbook both chosen, the statement frequency has to be defined here

Despatch Mode- Despatch Mode of statement has to be selected (Observation : This field is only valid 
when A/c statement field value is statement.

6. Relative to Staff – Value can be chosen as Yes or No.

7. Staff Id – in case of relative to staff, this value has to be filled. By default will be picked up from 
Relative to staff and staff id field will raise appropriate exception at the time of posting of transactions in 
this account by the concerned staff.

8.Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs).

Interest Details

2.3 KCC Bank Account Opening – Inte rest D et ails Use r t o select the ‘Interes t Det ails T ab.’ after 
successful submission of the ‘General Details’. This tab displays the details of the Interest to be paid or 
collected or both for the said account along with Tax Details. USER HAS TO VISIT THIS DETAIL AND ENTER 
NEXT INTEREST CALCULATION DATE (DR.).

2.4 KCC Bank Account Opening – Scheme Details User to visit the ‘Scheme Details Tab.’ after successful 
submission of the ‘General Details’ and ‘Interest Details’

User can select or enter valid values for these fields.

Scheme Details Tab- Enter Sanction Limit, Debt Acknowledge Date, Expiry Date, credit file no. 
,maximum allowed limit.

Account Limits Tab - Enter Sanction date, Expiry date, document date, review Date. Select 
Sanction Level, sanction authority, enter Limit Ref No, Select Drawing Power Indicator 
and enter drawing power.

Related Party Tab - Enter the co- applicant / guarantor details if any.

MIS Codes Tab - Enter required MIS Codes.

Document Details – Documents Collected from Customer can be entered.

On clicking Submit button account number will be created and displayed.

[Note: now user has to verify account using menu HOAACVSB. For modification before verification use menu 
HOAACMSB]

END OF DOCUMENT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank

( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )
 HOAACSB 
Opening of SB account 
 Menu option – HOAACSB 
 1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open. Valid values are O-Open/ T- Copy 
from Template. 
2. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique CIF ID of the customer. 
3. SOL ID – Mandatory field - By default home Sol ID is populated. 
4. CCY – Mandatory Field- By default CCY is populated. 
5. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the code of the scheme under which 
the account is to be opened. 
6. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - By default General Ledger Subhead Code is 
populated. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme Code typed must exist. 
7. Click on ‘GO’. (System will navigate to the General Details page)

2.2 Savings Bank Account Opening – General Details 
 General Details 
Function Navigation of the Selected Function General Details 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed on 
the top of the screen. 
2. A/c. Name – Mandatory Field - The name specified for the Customer ID during customer creation is 
displayed by default. It can be modified. 
 3. A/c Short Name – Mandatory field – System automatically shows the short name which can be 
modified. 
4. A/c Opening Date – Mandatory field - The BOD date is displayed by default.

5. Location Code – Mandatory field- Select the appropriate code from searcher. 
6. Mode of Operation- Mode of Operation of the A/c based on customer request such as Self, Either of 
Survivor etc. to be selected from searcher. 
7.A/c. Statement - Mandatory field - Select or type the mode of generating the account statement. Valid 
Values: B – Both/N – None/P- Pass Book/ S – Statement. 
 A/c Statement – Passbook or Both or None can be chosen.  Statement Frequency – In case of 
Statement (Pass Sheet ) and Passbook both chosen, the statement frequency has to be defined here  
Despatch Mode- Despatch Mode of statement has to be selected (Observation : This field is only valid 
when A/c statement field value is statement. 
6. Relative to Staff – Value can be chosen as Yes or No. 
7. Staff Id – in case of relative to staff, this value has to be filled. By default will be picked up from 
Relative to staff and staff id field will raise appropriate exception at the time of posting of transactions in 
this account by the concerned staff. 
8.Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit ot

f posting of transactions in 
this account by the concerned staff. 
8.Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs).

 Interest Details 
2.3 Savings Bank Account Opening – Interest Details User to select the ‘Interest Details Tab.’ after 
successful submission of the ‘General Details’. This tab displays the details of the Interest to be paid or 
collected or both for the said account along with Tax Details. USER ONLY HAS TO VISIT THIS DETAIL.

 Scheme details

 Cheque Allowed – Yes to allow Cheque Book facility and No to disallow Cheque Book facility 
 Nomination – Nomination to be taken in SB account. Hence radio button Yes to be chosen. 
 Cheque Provided by Bank – Default value is Yes

 Nomination details – 
Registration Number -Regn number cannot have special characters 
 CIF ID - Nominee CIF may also be provided, but not mandatory. 
 Relationship – Choose the relationship of the nominee with the Account Holder. 
 Nominee Name – If CIF not provided , enter the details else it will auto populate from Nominee CIF Id 
 Address Line 1,2,3 – If CIF not provided , enter the details else it will auto populate from Nominee CIF 
Id 
 City, State and Country - If CIF not provided , enter the details else it will auto populate from Nominee 
CIF Id Job Card FINACLE 10.X Savings Bank 
 Postal Code - If CIF not provided , enter the details else it will auto populate from Nominee CIF Id 
 Nominee Minor – If Nominee is minor choose Yes and fill Guardian Details 
  Nomination Pcnt –100 Pcnt for the Nominee must be entered.

[Note: Nomination details to be added for single nominee only. Multiple nominee details addition to be 
restricted in case of savings account.]

Related Party details - 
 The first record in relate party details is populated from the CIF ID. All other joint holders for the 
account can be assigned here for specific business purpose such as generation of account 
statement , can choose option for combined statement, SI Advice. Joint account holders CIF id is 
mandatory, for mandate holder, CIF id not mandatory. 
 Add Existing CIF id of customer in related part detail. 
 Either enter Title, Name and Address of joint holder/co-obligant.

 FFD Parameter details- 
System supports Flexi Fixed Deposit Facility i.e. Savings Plus Scheme. 
 FFD Scheme Code – TD 490 , the term deposit scheme code 
 GL Sub Head – Will be automatically picked up 
 Auto Sweep – Default value will be No 
 Sweep Out in Multiples of - The default value will be auto populated (ie25000) 
 Sweep Out Deposit Period – from 15 days to 120 months 
 Sweep Out Frequency – Daily 
  Sweep Out when bal Above – 50000 will be auto populated 
 Next Sweep Out Date – BOD 
 Repay Instruction – same as mode of Operation 
 Location Code – Enter the details  Auto Renewal – U 
  Auto Renewal Scheme – TD490

 Click on submit button.

[Note: now user has to verify account using menu HOAACVSB. For modification before 
verification use menu HOAACMSB]

END OF DOCUMENT

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India ) 
HOAACTD 
[ACCOUNT OPENING TERM DEPOSIT] 
The menu option HOAACTD is invoked for opening of a Term Deposit Account. The 
details process as follows – On invocation of the menu Criteria page is populated.

1. Function – Mandatory field – Select from dropdown – O-Open. Valid values are O-Open/ T- Copy 
from Template.

2. CIF ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the unique CIF ID of the customer.

3. SOL ID – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the SOL ID in which you want to open an 
account. By default home Sol ID is populated.

4. CCY – Mandatory Field- Select through search or Type the currency code in which the account will 
operate.

5. Scheme Code – Mandatory field - Select through search or type the code of the scheme under which 
the account is to be opened.

6. General Ledger Subhead Code – Optional field - Select through search or type the GL Subhead under 
which the account is to be opened. A valid combination of the GL Subhead Code and Scheme Code 
typed must exist.

8. Click on ‘GO’. (System will navigate to the General Details page)

Term Deposit - Account Opening – General Details 
 On clicking of ‘Go’ button, the General Details page is displayed.

1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed on 
the top of the screen.

2. A/c. Name – Mandatory Field - The name specified for the Customer ID during customer creation is 
displayed by default. It can be modified.

3. A/c Short Name – Mandatory field – System automatically shows the short name which can be 
modified.

4. A/c Opening Date – Mandatory field - Select or type the date on which the account is being opened. 
The BOD date is displayed by default.

5. A/c. Statement - Mandatory field - Select or type the mode of generating the account statement. 
Valid Values: B – Both/N – None/P - Pass Book/R - Deposit Receipt/S - Pass Sheet. BY DEFAULT IN TD 
ACCOUNT IT IS R-DEPOSIT RECEIPT

6. Allow Sweeps – Mandatory field - Click the appropriate value to indicate if sweeps must be allowed 
to the account. Valid Values: Yes/No.

7. ECS Enabled – Mandatory field - Click the appropriate value to indicate if ECS must be enabled for 
the account. Valid Values: Yes/No.

8. Allow A/c. Exemption for CCY Transaction Report - Mandatory field – Click the appropriate value to 
indicate the account exemption for currency transaction report. Valid Values are – Yes/No.

9. Charge Level Code, Location Code, A/c. Manager ID, Cash Debit/Credit Limit Exception, Clearing 
Exception Limit Dr./Cr., Transfer Exception Limit Dr./Cr., Channel Level Code, Ledger No., Collect 
Charges, Turnover Details, Notes, Relative to Staff, Preferential Calendar Base, Additional Calendar 
Base, Statement Frequency, Local Calendar, Dispatch Mode, Mode of Operation, Next Account 
Opening - Term Deposits JobCard Finacle 10.2.18 Doc.Ver.No.001 Page 6 of 9 Print Date, Contact

Phone No., Enable Pass Sheet Frequency at Related Party, Allow Sweeps, ECS Enabled, Appl.Ref.ID, 
Preferred Language Code and Name in Preferred Language are Optional fields. User can select or 
enter valid values in the required optional fields.

Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

Term deposit- Account Opening – Interest & Tax Information 
User to select the ‘Interest Details Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General Details’. This tab 
displays the details of the Interest to be paid or collected or both for the said account along with Tax 
Details. 
1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed 
on the top of the screen. 
2. A/c. Pegged – Mandatory field – Click the appropriate value to indicate if the interest rate for the 
account to be pegged. 
3. Int. Rate Code – Mandatory field – Enter the interest rate code for the account. Default value set 
in HGSPM is displayed. 
 4. Remaining fields are optional. User to input valid values in the required fields. Click on ‘SUBMIT’. 
(System will prompt to visit other Tabs.)

Term Deposit-Account Opening – Scheme Details 
User to visit the ‘Scheme Details Tab’ after successful submission of the ‘General Details’ and 
‘Interest Details’ tab.

1. Value Date –Mandatory field – User to select the value date of the deposit.

2. Click on check box Recover Interest on Tax Deducted for TDS

3. Maturity Date or Deposit period is mandatory field

4. Deposit amount must be entered

5. All remaining fields are optional. User can select or enter valid values in the required optional 
fields.Click on ‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs)

Term Deposit - Account Opening – Renewal & Closure Details 
User to visit the ‘Renewal and Closure Tab.’ after successful submission of the ‘General Details’, 
‘Interest & Tax Details’ and ‘Scheme Details’.

1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed 
on the top of the screen. 
2. All fields are optional. User can select or enter valid values in the required fields. Click on 
‘SUBMIT’. (System will prompt to visit other Tabs)

Term Deposits – Account Opening – Related Party Details 
User to visit the ‘Related Party’ Tab after successful submission of the ‘General Details’, ‘Interest & 
Tax Information’, ‘Scheme Details’ and ‘Renewal & Closure’ Tab.

1. Values for Function, CIF ID, CCY, General Ledger Subhead Code and Scheme Codes are displayed 
on the top of the screen. 
2. Relation Type – mandatory field - Select or type the type of authorization to be granted. Valid 
values are A - Authorized Signatory/C - CoObligant/D – DSA/G – Guarantor/H - Legal Heir/J - Joint 
Holder/L - Letter .

3. CIF ID, Title, Name and Address Line1 – mandatory fields – User to enter the CIF ID, Title, Name, 
address Line1 of the related party.

Click on ‘SUBMIT’.

Term Deposits – Account Opening – Nomination Details tab 
In Nomination Tab Fields- Registration No., Nominee Name, Address Line 1, State, Postal Code, 
Relationship, City, Country, Nomination Pcnt., are mandatory.

NOTE: Nominee Percentage should be 100%

Click on submit Button

System will Display Result-

NOTE: for modification before verification use menu HOAACMTD, and for verification of account use 
menu HOAACVTD.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
 ( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

SOP- HOCTM

Zone should be open before doing HOCTM through HMCLZOH 
 2.1 Outward Clearing Transaction Maintenance – Add (HOCTM) 
1. Invoke the menu HOCTM (System navigate the Criteria page)

2. Select or type the code of the function to be performed: Valid values are Add, Delete, Inquire, Modify, 
Verify, Release, Regularize

3. Select valid input for the field Zone date and zone code.

4. Click on to Go (System will navigate the user to details page)

5. On detail page, Select or type the number of the account to be credited

6. Enter the valid value for the field Amount field

7. Enter the Instrument No.

8. Select the valid input for the field sort code and transaction code.

9. After validating and provide all the details click on to submit button. 
NOTE:Remember to write set number on receipt for further use.

By clicking on ADD button you can add multiple cheques on same account number.

2.2 Outward Clearing Transaction Maintenance – Verify (HOCTM) 
Zone should be open before doing HOCTM 
1. Invoke the menu HOCTM (System navigate the Criteria page) 
 2. Select or type the code of the function to be performed: Valid values are Add, Delete, Inquire, 
Modify, Verify, Release, Regularize 
3. Select valid input for the field Zone date 
4. Select valid input for the field Zone code. 
 5. Enter the valid input in set number field.

5. Click on to Go (System will navigate the user to details page) 
6. On detail page , validate the all the input click on to submit button (System will display the success 
screen)

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India ) 
HPAYOFF 
[LOAN PAY OFF PROCESS] 
‘I-INQUIRY OF PAY OFF’ 
1- TO CHECK INTEREST OF ACCOUNT 
*SELECT FUCTION AS ‘I-INQUIRY OF PAY OFF’

2- ENTER LOAN A/C ID WHICH IS OF ‘LAA’ TYPE

3- ENTER TRANSACTION TYPE WHICH IS APPLICABLE

4- IF TRANSACTION TYPE IS SELECTED AS “T/BI OR T/CI” THEN ENTER COLLECT / REFUND A/C 
ID. CLICK ON GO.

5- SYSTEM SHOW ‘OVERDUE + INTEREST’ AMOUNT.

‘P-PAYOFF LOAN AMT’ 
6- COLLECT THE INQUIRED AMOUNT THEN SELECT 
*FUCTION AS – ‘P-PAYOFF LOAN AMT’ 
*ENTER LOAN A/C ID 
*SELECT TRANSACTION TYPE AS APPLICABLE

*COLLECT/ REFUND A/C ID MUST BE ENTERED WHEN TRANSACTION TYPE IS ‘T/CI OR T/BI’ 
THEN CLICK ON GO

6- IF AMOUNT IS RECEIVED THEN CLICK ON ‘CREATE TRANSACTION’

7- SYSTEM SHOW ALL THE TRANSACTION ACCOUNT

8- CLICK ON SUBMIT

Verify the record 
9- CLICK ON A/C ID SEARCHER

10- SELECT VALID A/C ID. CLICK ON GO

11- SYSTEM NAVIGATES TO NEXT

12- CLICK ON CREATE TRANSACTION. CLICK ON SUBMIT.TRANSACTION NO. GET GENERATED.

FOR REVERSAL OF PAYOFF 
1- SELECT FUNCTION AS “R-REVERSAL OF PAYOFF”. ENTER VALID LOAN A/C ID, SELECT VALID 
TRANSACTION TYPE (THROUGH WHICH THE RECORD IS ADDED). CLICK ON GO.

2- CLICK ON SUBMIT

NOTE: VERIFY THE RECORD BY ANOTHER USER.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

HPBP 
[PASSBOOK PRINTER] 
1. Invoke the Menu :- HPBP

2. Enter the Account Number, Select Printer Type as ‘ PR-50’ and If New passbook Print 
required than select ‘New passbook’ As ‘Yes’ else ‘NO’

3. Select Template File Name from drop down list

4. Click On Print , System show first page of Passbook than click on Print button for print 
passbook

5. Click on Yes if print Successfully

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank

( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )
HPBPR 
 Invoke the menu ‘HPBPR’ for Reset date for print

 Select function code as ‘B-reset’. Enter the A/c id. [from date and to date 
auto fill as BOD date].

 Select date from searcher

 Click on Accept, system will navigate to next field for select Transaction date 
and select date by clicking on check box.

 Click on SUBMIT.

NOTE:- after verifying the same ‘HPBPR’ record, system will reprint Passbook 
from select date transaction.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

SOP FOR INQUIRE OF UTR : HPORDM 
1. OUTWARD 
A. INVOKE MENU HPORDM. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS “INQUIRE”.

B. CLICK ON SEARCHER

C. If we have SNM number inquiry can be done through field ,enter SNM id in field “payment 
order ID “ and sol id can be entered or remain blank
D. CLICK ON SUBMIT THEN SYSTEM WILL DISPLAY DETAILS OF ENTERED SNM NO.

2. INWARD 
A . Select “In/out indicator” (when you want to INQUIRE inward neft/rtgs) select “INWARD” 
AND REMOVE PREFILLED FIELD SOL ID AND KEEP IT BLANK , ENTER UTR AND CLICK ON SUBMIT.

Madhya Pradesh Gramin Bank 
( A Joint Venture of Govt of India, MP Govt. & Bank of India )

HPORDM (FOR HRTGS) 
[MAINTAIN PAYMENT ORDER] 
ADD RECORD: 
1. INVOKE MENU ‘HPORDM’. SELECT FUNCTION CODE “A=ADD” FOR NEW RTGS/NEFT.

2. SELECT PAYMENT PRODUCT AS “CUSTOMER TRANSFER”

3. ENTER DEBIT ACCOUNT NUMBER IN FIELD “DEBIT A/C”.

4. SIGNATURE CAN BE INQUIRED (click on the circled symbol to view/navigate to svs page)

5. If payment debit through cheque, select intrument type from searcher –list will appear , select 
appropiate option for e.g. for cheque -CHQ

6. ENTER INSTRUMENT ALPHA/SERIAL NO IN HIGHLIGHTED FIELD (WHEN INSTRUMENT TYPE IS 
SELECTED THEN INSTRUMENT SERIAL NO MUST BE ENTERED)

7. ENTER /SELECT VALID INSTRUMENT DATE ( ctrl+x for current date )

8. ENTER VALUE FOR REMITTANCE CCY/AMT( VALID AMOUNT FOR REMITANCE FOR AMOUNT FOR 
RTGS)

9. Next - beneficiary customer details

10. Address type is auto selected with name and address –keep the current selection as it is, do not 
change the address type

 IF USER ID IS LOCKED

5. Select Enable User as “Yes”

6. Click on submit button.

 VERIFICATION OF LOCKED USER ID

1. Go to “Reset User Login Details”

2. Select Function as V-Verify

3. Click on Go button

4. Select the User ID to verify

5. Click on Submit button

 RESET USER PASSWORD

1. Go to Module “Reset User Login Details”

2. Select Function M-Modify

3. Enter “User Id “ in User ID field, then click on “GO” button

4. Select Reset Type as Password

5. Enter “New Password” and “Confirm Password” and click on Submit button.

 VERIFICATION- RESET USER PASSWORD 
Select Function as V-verify and select the user Id to be verified then click on submit 
button.

Note : User can Login through new password.

2. Select Function as M-Modify and enter User Id to be modified

3. Select Reset Type as “Login Status”

4. Click on Submit button

3. Click on Go button

4. Select the User ID to verify

5. Click on Submit button

Note: User can Login through Old password.

Deletion of uidmap 
1. Select Function D-Delete Record for deletion of UIDMAP

2. Enter the account number in ACCOUNT NUM field for which UIDMAP is to be deleted 
and click on Go button

3. Click on SUBMIT button to delete the record.

4. On successful deletion display message as “Record has been deleted please use DV 
option for verification”.

5. If record already deleted or pending in DV, then display message as “Record already 
deleted or pending for verification in DV”.

FUNCTION- DV(DELETE VERIFICATION) 
1. If non deleted record is verified, then display message as “No record Found”.

2. If record deleted from other sol, then display message as “Not deleted from this sol”.

3. On successful delete of Aadhaar card display message as “Aadhar Card has been deleted 
successfully”.

4. For deletion of Aadhaar if deleted for 2 nd time then system display message as “ AADHAR ONCE 
DELETED. PLEASE MAIL HO FOR DELETION”.

FUNCTION RD-REVERSE DELETION

Use Function RD-Reverse Deletion to reverse the deleted record and click on submit 
button

COLLATERAL UNLINKING IN LATDR ACCOUNT 
UNLINK COLLATERAL FOR OLD LATDR [ACCOUNT OPEN IN FINACLE 7]. 
1. INVOKE THE MENU HSCLM. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS I-INQUIRE, ENTER A/C IS AS LATDR 
A/C.

2. CLICK ON SEARCHER OF COLLATERAL ID FIELD NEW POPUP WINDOW APPEARS.

3. CLICK SUBMIT AND SELECT COLLATERAL DISPLAYED. [REMARK: NOTE THE COLLATERAL ID 
FOR FURTHER USE]

4. INVOKE THE MENU HSCLM. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS U-UNLINK, ENTER A/C ID (LATDR 
ACCOUNT), COLLATERAL ID. CLICK ACCEPT.

5. SELECT REASON CODE USING SEARCHER.

6. CLICK SUBMIT.

[NOTE: NOW USER HAS TO VERIFY RECORD USING MENU HSCLM]

IMP – “AFTER VERIFYING RECORD COLLATERAL WILL UNLINK WITH LATDR A/C BUT 
COLLATERAL ID NOT DELETED, HENCE USER IS UNABLE TO CLOSE TERM DEPOSITE A/C. 
FOR DELETING COLLATERAL ID USE MENU HCLM.”

DELETE COLLATERAL ID FOR OLD LATDR [ACCOUNT OPEN IN FINACLE 7] 
1. INVOKE THE MENU HCLM. SELECT FUNCTION CODE AS M-MODIFY. ENTER COLLATERAL ID. 
[COLLATERAL TYPE WILL AUTOFILL].

2. CLICK GO.

3. GOTO PARTICULARS TAB. SELECT WITHDRAW FIELD AS ‘YES’(AUTO FILL AS ‘NO’), REASON 
CODE USING SEARCHER.

4. CLICK SUBMIT.

[NOTE: NOW USER TO VERIFY HCLM RECORD, THEN ONLY USER IS ABLE TO CLOSE TERM 
DEPOSITE A/C].
